Reviews.Title: “Centrally situated”
Reviews.Author: millport-1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to all amenities. Room was very comfortable. Buffet breakfast could have been warmer although there was a nice choice and staff were very friendly and helpful. Dinner was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business”
Reviews.Author: ahiptragedy
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple times in 2011 and found my stays to be very pleasant. I enjoyed both the restaurants in the hotel. The front desk staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “time to renovate”
Reviews.Author: jamester1
Reviews.Content: I bought an internet package deal for this place, so I suspected that it might be in need of repair (so many of those packages are for deteriorating properties). It was. The "one bedrrom executive suite" was just two small rooms combined with the original adjoining room door, and the second room was barely converted into a living room. But it was spartan and in desperate need of a reno. The advertised jacuzzi tub didn't exist in either bathroom (both of which hadn't been renovated in 40 years, and included mould below the sinks at no extra charge). They could have put in one nice bathroom and it might have worked, but the two old original bathrooms just looked cheap. The advertised fridge also didn't exist, but they did eventually bring one up after some cajoling. The staff even acknowledged that the rooms did not have what the package advertised, but only offered to upgrade at a ridiculous surcharge....duh! The furniture was older and in need of replacement as well. The upside is that the bar/restaurant was great, the food was great, and the staff in this area was great. The location is also very convenient. If it ever gets renovated, this could be a nice destination.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and value”
Reviews.Author: Basia146
Reviews.Content: I have been at the Metropolitan several times and have always enjoyed the friendly service, unlike that at the big hotels where there are line-ups and many people (staff). The staff at the Met get to know you and always accommodate you. The location is excellent if you need to do anything in the downtown TO area, and the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: mschmitt255
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed at the Met for the weekend; we booked a one bedroom suite which provided plenty of room for the three of us. The cost of the suite was very reasonable and the location of this downtown hotel is perfect; close to Spadina and China town as well as the Eaton Centre and Yonge Street. The room is somewhat tired and could use updating; the TV's are not flat screen and the furniture needs to be updated. However, the room was very clean. We used room service twice and each time the service was attentive and the order was complete and well executed. The Met is a 'good value for money' hotel in downtown Toronto. I would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “its ok”
Reviews.Author: 27canadaboy
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the met/hotel last month for my partners birthday.the rooms need up dating a little but over all the hotel is fab this must be my 20th stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, but Rooms Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: FunkyMan3333
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average, and the rooms need updating. I stayed here one night on business in a King Suite. The lobby is very well-renovated, but unfortunately the rooms are not. The lighting is very dim, the bathrooms are old, and the rooms are on the small side. The television looked like it belonged in 1995, and the wifi signal was spotty - it barely worked from the desk, but was ok on the bed. Not strong enough to stream video, however. The gym equipment is fairly limited (4 old treadmills, 2 newer elliptical and a few free-weights), but the pool looked fine. On the plus side, the service was friendly (they brought me a complimentary toothbrush), and the bed was comfortable. The room I had was quite (21st floor, at the end of the hall), and the location is outstanding for the hospital district, and walkable to Queen, King and Front (20-25 minutes). Overall the hotel is not up to the standards of the Soho Metropolitan, but wasn't terrible. Average rating!

Reviews.Title: “Poor valet parking = poor review”
Reviews.Author: ElectricalTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife accompanied me to a business dinner in this part of Toronto, and we decided to stay the night rather than head home late in the evening. The room was average-sized and a little tired-looking, but it was clean and, much to my surprise, had windows that open (windows that work are increasingly hard to find). It was also nice to find a property that still has smoking rooms. Now, here's what ruined the whole experience. We used valet parking when we checked in and, upon checking out, I told the desk staff I would now need my car. They told me it would be about a 10-15 minute wait, as there was only one guy handling the valet parking. The wait proved a lot longer. I'm a pretty patient guy but I became really upset at the 45-minute mark. Still, I was not allowed to fetch my own car. It wasn't until 60 minutes later that the counter staff offered to take the valet charge off my bill. After being among the first to check out from a horde of people, I was the last to leave a now-empty lobby.

Reviews.Title: “I take back my previous review; I feel duped!”
Reviews.Author: sauceykat
Reviews.Content: So, previously, I reviewed this hotel asking what's with all the hate? I had only ever stayed in a nice King suite. I've stayed at this hotel numerous times and have recommended it to lots of people. Boy, am I embarrassed. Now that I live close to Toronto, and attend school downtown, I was planning on staying here more often as my little place in the city for late nights at school, winter storms, and conferences--in fact, I stayed for 4 days last week because of a conference I was attending downtown. Anyway, long story short, I found a great deal on the hotel's own website for a King room (not suite); I've only ever stayed in the suite before but the pictures looked nice and I naturally assumed that the standard king room would be the same as the suite, decor- and quality-wise, just much smaller without the living area and second bathroom. I was horribly wrong. I even requested a quiet room away from elevators so I could sleep and study. Upon checkin, I added an extra day to my stay (another big mistake, I should have looked at the room first) and had to prepay it to get the same web rate. I was sent up to a room on the 4th floor. This room looked like it belonged in a horror movie. It was horribly ugly, with faded pink fabric and decor, pink stained carpets with a moldy blue-black tinge around all the baseboards AND it was right next to the air exhaust from Wai La Heen (Chinese restaurant downstairs), so not only was it noisy but it STANK horribly too. I called downstairs and asked for a new room. I had to PAY to upgrade to a king suite because it was so bad. And since I had already prepaid for the room, including the 4th night now, I couldn't go anywhere else. Plus, the hotels downtown were booked up for various conferences. I feel like I was ripped off, like it was some kind of bait and switch scam and although I complained, nobody would do anything for me. This went from being my favourite hotel to the WORST hotel and I could never in good conscience recommend it to anybody again. I am kind of sad because it was my favourite hotel in Toronto--I've even received letters from the manager thanking me for my positive reviews and comments from the checkout survey. And I was a good, loyal customer; I always ordered room service and tipped well, and recommended the hotel. Well, to anybody thinking of staying here, I say BEWARE. I stayed here to save a little money from the official conference hotel and I now ended up paying a ton more than the conference hotel and for far inferior quality.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: CanadianSoloGirl
Reviews.Content: The location is great. the price is right, but this is not a luxury downtown hotel. The bathroom fixtures are old. I really get annoyed when the bathroom light is connected to the bathroom fan. The noise is awful. The TV is about 10 years old. I had the breakfast buffet which is included in the price. It was nothing special but no wi-fi in the restaurant meant I went to Starbucks the next morning. No mini bar or fridge. There is just a desk no table in the room which made it a bit difficult to spread out my work documents. The cleaning staff were pleasant and very competent. The front desk was slow at check out. If you aren't spending a lot of time in the hotel and need access to downtown Toronto, then this location is excellent. Just don't expect a lot from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Except for location, nothing going for it.”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metropolitan in Toronto, and I have to say it was worse than a motel. Glad I didn't pay for it, business did, but woul dnot recommend this place. Everything is old. From the 2.5 wide closet, to the taps in the sink, to the shower head. Definately not at 4 star hotel. Internet is not high speed! More comparable to a 56k modem, can't even watch a YouTube clip without it timing out. Only thing going for this is the location, just between City Hall and Greyhound station. No fridge, microwave, or anything to store food. Meant only for overnight stay, not week long like I did. I suspect bed bugs, as I got a few bites, but haven't seen them, albeit I see black dots (shells?) on the bed spread after a night sleep. TV is old CRT type. Noisy fan in washroom, and noisy a/c-heating unit by window. This place is tired. Room is small, comparable to Motel 6 size, but that's only $74/night, not $200.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: foxiileigh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week on our first stay in Toronto and loved it. The bed was spacious. The cot we requested arrived at the room just minutes after us. The room was always clean when we returned, even when we just stepped out for breakfast. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel because I thought it was expensive but actually it's pretty standard for the down town area. The coffee machine was easy to use, three phone extensions, nice view and great location. We will definitely be staying here again! The only blip was room service was expensive and the tip was included and the service wasn't great. He dropped the food, turned and left. Everything is in easy walk, from the Universities to the CN tower, nothing is more than 30 minutes on easy clean streets.

Reviews.Title: “not as nice as in the past”
Reviews.Author: buffgirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times over the last 20 years. This past weekend, it just didn't feel the same. The room I was in (706) needs updating especially the bathroom. The grout was off color and appeared dirty. The mattress was much too soft. There were no cups for coffee. The gym lacked its previous nice touches(at one time, cold towels). There were no bikes and the jacuzzi was out of order. On a more positive note, the waitress in the bar was very helpful and the dessert was delicious.Wish breakfast was included in our rate as it had been in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Requests are not taken seriously”
Reviews.Author: Anna C
Reviews.Content: I've always choosen to stay at this hotel when travelling for business. I like the proximity to the malls and various attractions but this hotel needs major renovations. I had booked a one bedroom suite and specifically requested not being at the end of a hallway. The room given to me was at the end of the hallway. I believe they prefer to assign the end of the hallway rooms first. I spoke up and was given a room right by the elevators. The washroom, carpets, tv all need upgrading. When booking online it asks if you have specific requests, no one pays attention to them.

Reviews.Title: “Was assigned a room someone was already sleeping in!”
Reviews.Author: StephTo77
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel after a late flight from Tokyo around 3:00am. I already had a reservation so I was given my room card and to my surprise when I opened the door I saw shoes and someone sleeping in the bed as the tv was still on the room was a little bright that I could see. I immediately closed the door and went back to the reception to tell them. The man in the room where I opened the door did not wake up, thank god. They said that there computers had been down all day and that someone most have forgot to write down that the room was occupied. I was given another room (no upgrade) and the dead bolt was not very secure so I felt nervous and couldn't sleep for the few hours I was there. I spoke to the manager when I was checking out and the staff member had told me what happened but I was only offered 10% refund of the cost of the room. Unfair and scary!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Laura W
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice this past year with the most recent during the holidays. It is excellent! Check in was prompt and friendly. Rooms though a little small (as in any large city) were extremely comfortable and clean. The location is perfect and only 2 blocks from Eaton Center. Very safe area and the parking rate is the best the area. I would not hesitate to recomment this hotel to everyone anad I would stay here again on my next trip to Toronto. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “I don't see what the fuss, and the high cost are for”
Reviews.Author: havecurveswilltravel
Reviews.Content: Room was TINY and we had to wait to check in. Pool area was a SAUNA. I requested a refrigerator via e-mail weeks before and still had to wait until close to dinner time for the fridge to be brought up to my room. Really not that impressed and for the same amount of money, could have stayed somewhere nicer, newer, and with decor from the last decade.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the website photos”
Reviews.Author: mhny2525
Reviews.Content: This is a classic case of false advertising. The website photos showed beautiful, modern rooms that were well appointed with some of the best finishings. The reality (and I stayed in a suite) was a room that hadn't been updated in 20 years, with televisions so old you could barely get a clear picture. The carpet was rippled bordering on threadbare and the wardrobe closets were so flimsy they may as well have been made of balsa wood. I have stayed at the Soho Metropolitan Toronto and the Metropolitan Vancouver and it amazes me that this hotel is even allowed to carry the same name.

Reviews.Title: “tricked”
Reviews.Author: bdaltybenn
Reviews.Content: When you ener the lobby it looks nice enough, beautiful Chritmas Tree, nice doorman, etc....but when you get to your room it is completely different. Our room was in sorry need of re-modeling. The decor and bathroom were VERY dated. It was also he smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in in North America. I mean really small. Location as good. oh yeah, snotty girl at front desk didn't like that I complained about them trying o charge me $1.75 pr 5 minutes hen dialing out on my 1-800# calling card. She was ignorant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value!”
Reviews.Author: okamod2
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the close proximity to the Princess Margaret hospital as I had a 4:30am appt there and we could walk from the hotel. We loved the fact that it was on a quiet street and away from the hustle and bustle of the way more expensive hotels on Queen St. at half the price! The room was a bit small and dated but the king size bed comfortable and everything clean. We had a cocktail and appetizer at the bar and planned to go to the Hemisphere restaurant a bit later for dinner and was told it closed at 10pm. When we got there at 9 we were told they closed early as there were no customers which I thought odd for a Sat night but maybe they get more business during the week with the business crowd. At any rate the service in the bar earlier was excellent and the wait staff friendly. We were able to walk to the city hall, AGO, theaters on King St and there were lots of restaurants nearby to choose from. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, luxurious hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: aclassen
Reviews.Content: I did not select that hotel since I was on a business trip and it had been selected on my behalf. But I saw quite a lot of negative comments in the list of reviews and was a bit wary about it. However, there was absolutely nothing wrong with that hotel. Centrally located, it was easy to maneuver around the city. The reception lobby was just fine, and the staff was very friendly and competent. My room was on the 21st floor, and I enjoyed it for two nights. It was a wonderful room, with a delightful bed, a sturdy yet soft mattrass. Except for a fridge, there was everything I could have imagined, including an iron, a bathrobe, plenty of soaps, shampoos, etc. The shower was superb, and I had lots of towels. The heating worked very well. Lighting and decor were just fine and even elegant. I enjoyed most the great wireless service and could do a lot of work in my free time, when I was not walking around. I did not try the dinner, but a stranger approached me when I looked at the menu (after I had had dinner already outside) and strongly recommended their salmon as one of the best he had ever eaten. I tried the breakfast buffet (21 CAN dollars), and found it to be very good, plenty, and nicely varied (scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, sausages, tomatoes, a variety of fruit, cheese, ham, jam, yogurt, cereals, milk, juice, coffee, French toast. I was stuffed, but really liked it. Late at night I had a wine in their bar, and the environment there was very pleasant as well. Everything looked new and well taken care of. The bathrooms below the lobby were excellent. I have no idea what other reviewers might have complained about. Ok, Front Street is ca. 20-30 minutes away on foot, but there were so many wonderful restaurants in the vicinity (especially on Elm Street behind the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: RavensFlight
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel in November, as I was attending a conference there. The lobby of the hotel was very clean and spacious, and appeared fairly recently renovated. The staff were very courteous and helpful during both check-in and check-out, with I was served very quickly both times. My room was clean and the bed very comfortable, but I found the decor to be a bit surprising. It did not look anything like the pictures of the rooms on the hotel website, or the overall image projected by the hotel. As another reviewer has pointed out, it was "dated", more than anything else. The bed had a padded fabric headboard, the pattern on the wallpaper had a seashell motif, etc. Perhaps they are redecorating, and had not made it to my floor yet. The meeting facilities were nice, and the food provided during lunch was delicious. They provided a lot of choice, and I heard no complaints about the quality. The hotel is within easy walking distance to the Eaton Centre, and there are lots of restaurants in between. I would stay there again, but probably only if I had a meeting on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sahodgson9
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here and doubt I'll be back a third. The first time I was lucky enough to be upgraded to a one bedroom suite and it was great. Obviously the staff treat you according to what room you are staying in because on that stay everyone was very friendly and hospitable. That is not the case this time. The room I was given is very small and extremely outdated. I asked if there was any chance of an upgrade since I am going to bere for 5 nights and I waslooked at as if I had 2 heads. Once I got into the room and saw just how small it is I again called down to the desk to confirm this was the best they could do. I got a different person and this time was treated very poorly even though I was being extra nice. The room isclean but that's about all I can say. The TV is old with a poor picture, other than the bed and one small desk there is noplace else to sit and relax. Unfor tunately, I'm stuck here for 5 nights! There are many better hotels in downtown Toronto and my advice is to choose one of those!

Reviews.Title: “Decent value”
Reviews.Author: Ski G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok. The rooms were clean and starting to become dated. Not quite totally dated, but close. The lobby was clean and spacious, the elevators worked and the staff was pleasant enough. I enjoyed the lobby bar. Not central to Front St. or the financial district, but the price reflects that. Add $10 for a cab ride if necessary. $10 from YTZ as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but somewhat dated for the price.”
Reviews.Author: mpsrent
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property a number of times over the years and feel that is starting to show it's age. While the bedding is modern and the amenities are up to current standards, the room decour is very dated (late '80's or early 90's) and well worn. There is a musty smell in the room, either from the carpet or the heating/air con unit. Room size is average and typical of the time when this hotel was built. The one negative that is almost impossible to overcome is the noise from the 1990 circa heating/air con unit. Unless you are a very sound sleeper, be prepared to wake up every time this jet aircraft unit starts up. From a positive perspective, the hotel is situated in the heart of the city right behind the City Hall. Restaurants, pubs, shopping and events are all within an easy walk. Sadly my impression is that the hotel management are resting on the excellent location by charging top rates while offering a dated and somewhat disappointing product. There are far better options available in the same general location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service, lost the booking”
Reviews.Author: Travelista123
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation on Sunday, October 30th for the following Sunday for my mother. Upon her arrival at the hotel, they told her they had no record of her booking. I called the hotel and their manager on duty, who I asked to be connected with asked me if I thought it was a "joke". Obviously not, since I had spent the last 30 minutes trying to sort it out. She stated that I could have made the reservation anywhere by calling the 800 number, on their website nonetheless. Please stay somewhere else, they don't deserve your business. On the other hand I HIGHLY reccomment the Hilton Garden Inn. They accomodates us for a rate cheaper than the Metropolitan and they have their records sorted out.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing”
Reviews.Author: EMME_1155004
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed in the Metropolitan Hotel. Notwithstanding that my employer has a very favourable corporate rate with this hotel, I will be staying at another hotel when I am next in Toronto on business. POSITIVE ELEMENTS: - the bed was comfortable; - the bed linens and towels were new and clean; - it looked as if the cleaning staff had tried to clean the room thoroughly. NEGATIVE ELEMENTS: - the room was very dated and likely had not been renovated since the 1980s (I had asked for a renovated room after seeing the room but I was told that none were available); - the room and furniture were very tired (patched peach-coloured wallpaper, stained teal-coloured rug and dented wooden furniture); - the desk light didn't cast enough light to work; - the window didn't open, so I had to turn on the fan and the air conditioner to cool down the room but the unit was so loud that I couldn't fall asleep when it was running; - when I was taking a shower in the morning, the water stopped completely for almost 5 minutes (there was no water in the sink faucets either) and, when the water finally started again, the water pressure was almost non-existent; and - I mentioned the problems with the water to the front desk when I checked out, I received no apology (and no reduction in the bill) but merely an acknowledgement that other guests had had the same problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Bjarkithors
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit date, needs some renovation. I stayed there for nine days with my girlfriend. The hotel is very good value for money. It's well located near Dundas Square, Eaton Shopping center and other attractions. The room was extreamly soft and it felt like sleeping on a cloud. The carpet and the curtains were very old and discoloured. The staff were very friendly and the room was always clean when we returned from our sightseeings. The ac-system was very loud

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but rooms need to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in Sept. The location is good, right at the city. We parked our car in the garage and could walk around the beautiful city. But the rooms are really needed to be renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Good weeknight price but disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: edemec
Reviews.Content: Weeknights in downtown Toronto are quite expensive and I had a dinner and theatre booked and wanted to save us the drive home. The price was reasonable and it looks like a really nice hotel. The room was all pink and ressembled a bedroom at your grandma's house. The pool was pleasant. The big hitch was when we returned to our room to get ready for the day only to discover they had shut off the water in our section of the hotel. By the time they had someone come to show us to another room where we could shower (25 minutes later) we had to leave as we had meetings to attend...with wet, chlorine hair and no shower. The staff at the front desk comped us the valet parking charge but I really just want a hotel with running water. Probably won't be staying there again unless we can't find anything else for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: fifi090
Reviews.Content: Pleasant place to stay in Toronto within easy walking distance of shopping areas. Nice clean room and good pool and gym area for relaxation after a busy day. Staff very pleasant and helpful, particularly in the bar area. Not sure it qualifies as 4 star but would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired”
Reviews.Author: lovetorunallthetime
Reviews.Content: I have to say i rencently stayed at this property and didnt fully experience the entire property however our room was very tired looking and worn what was suppose to be a king size bed was clearly not and the internet connection was terrrible - on the brighter side great location and great staff and the bar was also enjoyable unfortunately would i stay at this property again probably not just on the fact of the rooms were outdated and very tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Place - Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Mixiepixie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for six nights in early October. First room they put me in had a filthy carpet. Changed rooms only to be put in a different room with a foul smell. Ended up having to upgrade which wasn't all that much better. Found the whole place dated. Gym bit of a joke. Would not stay here again and would certainly not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice room”
Reviews.Author: TuppenceIsleofMan
Reviews.Content: Great location, 10 minute walk to shops, 15 minute walk to harbour area. Hotel nice, very friendly helpful staff, nice room with huge bed. Tea and coffee facilities in room and free wifi. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: lukas19
Reviews.Content: Disappointed with size of rooms. Looked at several, but all seemed to be the same size. Bathroom very dated, But bed was really comfortable, which was good as we stayed for 6 nights. Breakfast was good, with really nice fresh orange juice. Everywhere was spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, basic stay with street noise”
Reviews.Author: JakeAdams72
Reviews.Content: I spent Oct. 15/16 at the Metropolitan for the Scotiabank Toronto Waterfront Marathon. I'll make it quick: This seems like an old Holiday Inn from the 1970s that received nice new bedding. Otherwise, it's pretty basic and a very low three-star hotel. The AC/heat hums like a 1982 unit, and the double-pane windows didn't fully blot out the noise of random street idiots at 4am on Dundas. The TV was from 2002, but there were plenty of channels. The bathroom needs updating and how about a fridge? There are ice machines on every other floor and vending on the mezzanine level. Really? I got a discount rate of $174 with the tax. Reasonable? Yes, because of the location. You are steps away from Dundas Square, Eaton Centre and the subway. I overslept and still had plenty of time to get to the Coach Terminal, literally a block away. You are very close to all of the major tourist destinations. But they don't honour airline mileage programs, and I wonder if staying at the Delta or Sheraton or other nearby hotels -- even the Soho Metropolitan -- would be nicer. Again, this trip was for convenience to the start and finish of the marathon and for that it was perfect. But I was expecting so, so much more.

Reviews.Title: “"Such a DISAPPOINTMENT!"”
Reviews.Author: J H
Reviews.Content: To start, I booked 2 rooms on 1 card at the exact same time, and when we arrived the rooms were 2 floors apart! Staff said there was nothing they could do. Rooms were very disappointing, Nothing like the pictures on any of the websites for this hotel. Saw several of the rooms and NONE that I saw, not even a suite looked like the pictures. Room was in mauve and light blue, probably hasnt been redone since the 80's. Bathroom was dirty, shower had mold in it, carpet was nasty also.

Reviews.Title: “Always a delight to stay here”
Reviews.Author: sunjooadvani
Reviews.Content: The Met is in the midst of it all, yet a quiet haven to also get away from the bustle. It's located in the heart of Toronto, close to the Eaton Centre, the hospitals, and the City Hall is right behind the property. The rooms offer great views of the skyline. Service is very friendly, the staff are very helpful, and the rooms and beds VERY comfortable. I always enjoy staying here - it's like a second home.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel for the money!”
Reviews.Author: steve b
Reviews.Content: We were travelling the east coast of America, Niagra and Canada and were warned about Toronto before we arrived. We were so concerned we reduced our stay to one night and it was best thing we did. The Metropolitan hotel was such a disappointment. We had a large room/suite which was out dated and of poor design and very expensive. It was basically one suite with an ajoining bedroom which meant we had 3 bathrooms and 3 queen beds all of which were not needed. One king bed and a roll out bed for our 2yr son would have done! We would not return.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely disgusting!!!!”
Reviews.Author: denash17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here onour honeymoon,could not get out of their fast enough!!!The room was tiny and smelled so bad we walked in a walked straight back down stairs to ask for a room change!!!staff not very helpful told no rooms!!after leaving us waiting to check in for 10+mins before that..Would def NOT recommend staying here.Dirty hotel,carpets in serious need of a change on all floors!Entrance lobby looks lovely doh!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick184
Reviews.Content: 5 of us stayed here in march and we had no problems. The staff were so friendly and helpful. They helped organise anything we needed and full of great recommendations. The pool and gym are free to use, i went twice a day . The rooms are very comfortable. there is a bar and resturants in the hotel all are very good. You are in a great location I loved Toronto my favourite destination so far

Reviews.Title: “Grandma house but worse!â€�I Agree with U I also Add that Many Days Inn Hotel Looks Better & U Don't Pay 229 a Night”
Reviews.Author: Grace M
Reviews.Content: Grandma house but worse!â€�I Agree with U I also Add that Many Days Inn Hotel & Travel Lodge, and Quality Suite Inn Looks Much Better & You Don't Pay $229 + 26%a Night. Metropolitan Hotel on 108 Chestnut Street - Never mind there is no Fridge-Bar in the room, the safe is unusable cuz is shot , and super tini wardrobe closet. It seem more life an Iron board/ brums storage space, and not a wardrobe closet. The shower tab knob came off when I turned the shower on. It never happend to me In my whole world travelling in 30 years. I have never seen a Hotel with 20"s storeys with gym and pool with such a tini wardrobe closet, and smelly pillow even thought the pillow case looked crispy white. I did not dare to remove the pillow case cuz I did not want to see the age and colours of the pillows. | However, I gave to the hotel maid to smell the set of pillows , and she made a funny face, then brought me a new set of pillow, and nom smelly ones just like was suposed to be (clean & new ) The Hotel does not deserve the rating dollars for a 4 star Hotel. It's not like the York Hotel, It's not Like the Sheraton Hotel. It's nothing alike to compare with the Metropolitan in Vancouver. Inside decor of the Metropolitan Hotel is more alike a Super 8 Hotel. I wish I would have been charged the Super 8 Hotel Price. Therefore, I am still upset I will never go back to stay at Metropolitan Hotel, when the Sheraton Hotel, and York Hotel are booked full. I would rather stay at the Quality Inn Suites at the Airport then go back to Metropolitan Hotel - 108 Chestnut - Downtown, and II don't care if I have to rent a car and drive to town back and forth t'll go back and stay at the Quality Inn Suites at the Airport, I loved! Its worth the afford. for the quality of building and hotel room and everthinhg. We had dinner next door at the Texas Gril. The travel Lodge and Days Inn, which are right across the street. I extremely recommend the Qualitity Inn Suites. Its located just 1km from the airport arrival gate - car rental. The hotel shutler was very great. My answer to Mr Clareco nom intelligent coment(http://www.tripadvisor.com/members-reviews/clareco) I feely sorry for him for been used to be a frequent customer of Super 8 Hotel paying Shangrilla price and never been to One Shangrilla Hotel. His non intelligent remarks proves that he dosen't know what a hight quality hotel of 4 stars is all about. I strong belive the old say "quotes" apply to him " what one never had one will never miss" I truly feel sorry for his egnorance. In case he is staff of Metropolitan, he is trying to do his job by mislead people to make belive the hotel is a super hotel which is not for the price which charge the customers.Metropolitan Hotel is a rip off and I rest my case. Only 2 1/2 stars

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ProspectGeoff
Reviews.Content: Touring Canada, this hotel is well positioned and has friendly staff, as well as excellent restaurants. Its is central and walking distance from many of the downtown sights. Rooms are not large, but quite adequate

Reviews.Title: “Location's good; Hotel's average and dated.”
Reviews.Author: kirklandLake
Reviews.Content: Not impressed with service or hotel decor. It's dated and not maintained. Location is ok. Rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Same old, same old!”
Reviews.Author: flipandjude
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very average and the decor is dated and not too well maintained. It is in a reasonable location but so are many others. if you are using it as a jumping off point from the airport and are not bothered about queuing for 90+ minutes for the CN Tower, then stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Took a chance despite some poor reviews!”
Reviews.Author: SeniorTraveller11_60
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan was suggested as hotel accommodation for a course recently attended at U of T. While some of the reviews had us wondering, we decided to book here and were not disappointed. The king size bed was very comfortable and the pillows and sheets were exceptional. The duvet was enclosed inside lovely sheets - so much nicer than blankets that are not laundered between users.Towels large and luxurious. The bathroom was very clean. Ventilation could be improved, but that was a minor inconvenience. This was the last night of the Toronto Film Festival - but the room was very quiet so we weren't disturbed by noise of party goers. Great location for restaurants too. We requested the corporate rate and were pleased with that too. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what these idiots are talking about!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: clareco
Reviews.Content: I came into the hotel for the International Film festival. I had seen all those negative blogs and was truly concerned about the rooms etc. and so I called and they informed me that I had a deluxe king room, and not to even look at those blogs. Not only did I receive the MOST WONDERFUL SERVICE, INCLUDING ROOM SERVICE< FRONT DESK SERVICE,and MAID SERVICE, I experienced 2 nites in the Penthouse Paris suite :CLEAN, NO SMELLS, NO NOTHINGS. It was perfect in every way. It will always be my hotel in Toronto. CCC

Reviews.Title: “a bit dated but reasonable price and good service”
Reviews.Author: Jackie M
Reviews.Content: I will stay there again. Not so sure my husband would have liked the pink room.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: NFE47
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan is at best an OK hotel. We were there overnight on a Friday arriving early afternoon and leaving Saturday mid-morning. There always seemed to be a lineup to check in or out and the front counter staff did their jobs efficiently but didn't really seem to care all that much. The underground parking ($21 per day) was very tight for a Ford Escape. Can't imagine how a large vehicle could navigate it. The room was quite small and the carpet had definitely seen better days... some time ago. The queen sized bed was comfortable which is critical and they offered free bottled water(unusual but appreciated). Their main floor restaurant offered a great breakfast but the servers were disinterested. Their bar, for afternoon drinks, was great. The server in particular was friendly, courteous, full of fun and kept bringing us nibbles while we were there. He went out of his way to make sure that we had all we needed but wasn't pushing us either to drink more or to leave. He gets the gold star. I wish I had his name. He was truly the exception in the customer service category. Overall I think I'll try another hotel next time I'm in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but my credit card was compromised shortly after leaving”
Reviews.Author: G L
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, great restaurant and adequate facilities. However, a few weeks after my stay charges from other countries started to appear on my credit card statement. Since I only used my credit card to stay in this hotel, I know that it must have been compromised here. Judging by some of the other reviews this seems to be the case. Its not always feasible to pay cash when staying multiple nights for business and a therefore a credit card is the only way to pay. I will be booking elsewhere for my future business trips to Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewEC1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel rooms are seriously in need of an update to the year 2011, they are currently stuck in the 1980's. Having said that, they are great vaue for money. The one bedroom suite we got had a brilliant view of the city, and everything that we needed was provied for. The front desk staff are extremely helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “good time”
Reviews.Author: jenjab25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a very busy area in china town so if you do not like that then this hotel is not for you. However, if this does not bother you then the hotel itself was very nice and clean. The pool was nice and there was also access to a gym. They do charge you a facility fee of about $8 or so even if you do not use the facilities so make sure if you go you get your use out of them. Overall, I would stay there again and recommend it to other people

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located but mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: ryanbruce
Reviews.Content: Location great for exploring Toronto. 15 mins walk to church street with lots of bars. 5 mins walk to shopping centre. 20 mins walk to CN tower. Rooms not great. Our room was a smoking room. It was shabby and old fashioned. The bathroom was tired. It looked like it was furnished in the 80's. Reception and restaurant not bad though breakfast expensive. I wouldn't choose this hotel again unless I was on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value, Some Improvements Needed”
Reviews.Author: sgkca
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Metropolitan Hotel in August 2011. The overall experience was fine but I would strongly encourage an udpate to the accommodations. First, the good points: great pillows, service in the restaurant was excellent, room was very quiet, self-serve parking in basement. Check-in was bumpy because our first room reeked of cigarette smoke and we had to come back down to request a second room. The woman at the front desk was polite and helpful and we ended up storing our luggage for about 3 hours. Second, the not-so-good points: furniture in room very dated, peeling paint and damaged/stained carpet in room. Our room did not match the lobby, another example of a disturbing trend in hotel renovations: spending $$$ on hotel entrance, lobby, and public spaces and merely spending $ on the actual rooms. I would also warn folks with large SUVs that the hotel's underground parking lot is incredible narrow and hard to navigate. We were in a standard size car and found the lot quite tricky. Note: when you enter the parking garage you have to take an immediate hard right. Final analysis: We paid $129 for our room via Expedia. For that rate this hotel is certainly a decent value and credit is warranted to the great restaurant staff. If you can get a similar rate then this hotel will serve your needs nicely. If you can only find higher rate ($150+) for your desired day(s) the value proposition quickly declines and I would recommend you take your business to another downtown Toronto hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall, noisy one night”
Reviews.Author: Kelly P
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here this summer for a vacation week of exploring Toronto. I was very happy with the location: within walking distance to Dundas Square, as well as metro stations and cable car stops, so we were able to go all over the city as much as we wished with our metro passes. Parking is of course not very cheap, but it was nice to have my car parked in a secure garage underneath the hotel all week. We were treated well by the staff. The room was clean but not very fancy. However, we got a pretty basic room. The beds were comfy, which is all that matters at the end of the day! There are two restaurants in the hotel, and room service is available, but the prices are outrageous, so we did not partake! There are plenty of places to eat within walking distance. The only other downside was that one night the people in the room next to us were extremely loud late at night, so the walls must be pretty thin. And, since the place isn't that inexpensive, other little amenities would have been nice, like a refrigerator or a nicer view! Overall, a pretty good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: ABABen
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is older, the location is great (right off Queen street and UofT) and it's pet friendly. We stayed one night with our 70lb Weimaraner and every staff member we walked past was courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Musty smelly rooms”
Reviews.Author: JoJoQ
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the on premise parking and its central location. The hotel is dated - the rooms are very small and a little dingy. The worst was the musty odor which smelled oily - like hair gel - ugh. We let the air conditioner run for a couple of hours but it didn't work. There is a well known Chinese restaurant that we didn't have a chance to try out - maybe next time but the Hemispheres cafe was quite nice for a couple of small bites.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: colacard
Reviews.Content: If you like rude front desk staff and bellmen, this is the hotel for you. Every single time we've stepped outside the hotel to catch a taxi, we've been accosted by panhandlers. I finally asked the bellman on duty why the hotel allowed panholders to come onto the property and ask guests for money, to which he replied: "I am not a security guard and that is not my job". I asked him why security allowed that and he said the hotel did not have security! Our room has buckled carpet, the restaurant prices are outrageous and the staff could not care less. I cannot wait to check out of this dump on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “I Was Going to Stay 3 Nights and Checked Out after 1”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: Forget it. Stay somewhere else. For the same rate, I checked in 1 block away at the lovely Sheraton Centre Hotel. The Metropolitan needs a complete refurbishment. It is dark, cold, and ugly. There is a small lobby, front desk staff were not friendly, and totally lacks ambience in the hotel. If you like Days Inn or Motel 6, this is a fine hotel for you. If you expect anything better, then go somewhere else. One benefit was the business center room with 2 computers and printer for free. Hotel shower water was sufficiently hot and good pressure. Bed was comfortable, and hotel was quiet except my air conditioning unit was loud so I had to shut it off. The Japanese restaurant in the hotel was surprisingly excellent. I had the dim sum for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: posterns
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed here for 4 nights. Hotel is conveniently located to downtown entertainment, restaurants and shopping. Just 2 short blocks from subway stop. Hotel is clean, rooms are small but nice and very comfortable bed. Hotel staff was very helpful as well -- got us a car for one day on a Saturday at a morning hour before the rental companies were even open. We were able to return the rental to the hotel parking lot when we got back (late a night). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of a Dump”
Reviews.Author: diamondsnowball
Reviews.Content: The hotel isn't in a great area of downtown (right near the greyhound bus station). The room is ok - nothing special, but not terrible either. The service wasn't great. I would not recommend this hotel unless you get an extraordinary deal. The name is deceptive....there is nothing particularly metro or cool about this basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NASTY NASTY HOTEL!! IF YOU LIKE COCKROACH BEETLES STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: lovepink91
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I checked into this hotel after a recent trip to Toronto enroute to Montreal. On July 19/2011 we checked in at around 3pm, parked and if I can go on forever on how awful the parking situation was I would. Parking spaces are absolutley tiny and if you drive a SUV or larger sedan GOODLUCK GETTING IN A SPOT. Parking was 21$ which wasnt too bad but to have to squeeze in a little hole it's frustrating to say the least. When you walk in it's very out dated compared to other 3.5 star hotels in downtown toronto, the carpets are gross and damp, wallpaper looks like its from the 80's, tv is a huge tube tv like it was the first ones ever made. We booked our hotel through Hotwire last minute and got a rate of 110CAD incl taxes and after our experience wouldnt even pay 20$ to stay there. After our night out I was in the bathroom getting ready to go to sleep while my boyfriend went downstairs to get my suitcase from the car and I walked out to get in bed and seen a HUGE NASTY BEETLE LIKE COCKROACH ON THE WHITE SHEETS ON THE BED. I WAS SO DISCUSTED. I immedietley grabbed a drinking glass to put on top of it, changed, packed all my things and checked the hell out!! We called the front desk ( this was all in between 2-3am ) and she sent security up to look and the bug was still under the glass, he took it with him and we checked out. The night desk clerk was really rude and so unhelpful, she didn't offer any compensation nor any empathy for our situation as if it was something that was normal. Parking was re-imbursed and Hotwire refunded our night from hell's stay. At 3am in the morning we were left with nowhere to go but start driving to our destination 6 hrs away in Montreal. Absolutley discusted with the service and cleanliness of this hotel and I'm not picky at all. PAY AN EXTRA 30$ FOR A BETTER HOTEL!!! While we waited for security to come we took pictures. They are added in the photo album.

Reviews.Title: “good/okay hotel in the center”
Reviews.Author: NWtd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located near the city center with a good price for the rooms. I thought the rooms where a little out dated by everything works fine. Free wifi in your room and in the public area's of the hotel. The food was good and I liked the fact there are two restaurants in the hotel. If you're staying for business and having a jetlag this is your hotel! I missed some kindness at the front office. Next time I will be in Toronto for business I stay in this hotel but if I go with my partner I think I'll look for a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Great location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: DrDaveCumbria_UK
Reviews.Content: Great stay here â€“ nothing much to write about it because everything just worked. Great staff â€“ really friendly and helpful. The room was lovely and the king-size bed was just fabulous. The hot water was of the luxurious super-hot variety so you can have a bath as hot as you can stand. The fitness room was good. The location is excellent â€“ you're within walking distance of everything that is downtown. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with an extremely nice staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zielkin
Reviews.Content: I was there with my wife for 2 nights, very suprised with a free upgrade to a better room!!!! Very clean and spacious!!! Very good location!!! Definately will come back if stay in Toronto next time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly and a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: 31Taffman
Reviews.Content: I am going to place on record our appreciation of the high quality service provided by the staff of the Metropolitan hotel, during our recent 8 day stay in July 201. This is the second time we have stayed at the Metropolitan in 8 months and we can honestly say that the high standards of service remain consistent. We had a very quick check in and the concierge, [who recognised us from 8 months ago â€“ what a memory!]. He saw to it that we received an upgrade. This was very much appreciated as we needed the space to relax in the coming week, after visiting our sick family relative, in the last days of their life. The front of house staff made us feel very welcome and are great ambassadors to the city of Toronto and the Metropolitan Hotel. Jing and Ronnie were a great source of ideas. They made us feel that we had made a good friend and always had a wave for us whenever we came in. They certainly deserve huge credit for making our trip a very special one, considering the circumstances. Others who deserve special mention are the bar and restaurant staff. Yet again, they made us feel very welcome, and part of the Metropolitan family. The friendliness and interest in our visit, was a great source of comfort. Our thanks go to these 2 very special members of staff. We shall miss them both very much indeed. Naturally, in any organisation, there are unsung heroes of staff who deserve praise for their service:- Our room was cleaned daily to a very high standard, The kitchen staff, who provided such lovely food for us to experience, certainly deserve recognition, and The doormen, who always greeted us with a smile. [This was very welcome after returning from the hospital]. Finally, we thoroughly recommend the Metropolitan as a superb venue to explore downtown Toronto. Sadly, it is unlikely that we shall be returning in the future. We hope that others who visit this great place, will also get the same satisfaction as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Good value. Hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: Hulcott
Reviews.Content: I stayed couple nights in early July 2011. I feel the price was giving me good value. It's just a couple blocks away from Dundas Square and unless you are totally precious about walking up Dundas West this is a tidy location. The little pool is cute. The wifi was easy and did not le me down once. I think the rooms could do with a very careful clean in places but I accidentally found th stain on th curtains in 1701. Overall I recommend to budget conscious

Reviews.Title: “worth of every penny”
Reviews.Author: reindeer_11
Reviews.Content: Just returned with my teenage daughter. 1st time in Toronto and would repeat it definately in this very hotel! Beds super comfortable, lovely view from 24th floor and good service. Room cleaning very good. Nice pool + exercise room and everything within walking distance; CN tower, Eaton Centre just couple of blocks away. (or subway - easy) and trendy Queens St. west for younger shoppers.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: roxycris_d
Reviews.Content: The service is completely terrible. I would not waste my time on this hotel when Toronto has many great hotels. also major losing points is no room service after 11. Total Fail

Reviews.Title: “It was nice but rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: bob91107
Reviews.Content: The location is pretty good. You can walk to CN tower, waterfront, museum or take the metro. Hotel made it very easy to rent a car for drive to Niagra. Staff is pleasant/helpful. Room was clean and small and it was difficult to maintain a comfortable temparture (and this was the "luxury" room).

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay here”
Reviews.Author: PGoyert
Reviews.Content: I wass in Toronto for three days on business and was put up in the Metropolitan. Really nice, clean quite (22nd floor) and close to everything. Staff was very accomodating and helpful. Day parking at $21 a day is a bit on the pricey for guests but I'd definetly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Formiga
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on business. The front desk was kind enough to let me check in early. Upon entering the hotel the lobby looked nice. Upon exiting the elevator on the 11th floor it went downhill really fast, it was dark, the decor was shabby and old. I was given a room with 2 twin beds but it reminded me of a motel. The room was outdated, I wore fliflops around the room because the carpet looked old and dirty, the TV was an oldschool tube type, not flat screen. When I checked my duvet there were blood stains, the airconditioner was noisy, and you can hear everyone in the hallway. I was constantly woken up in the morning by slamming doors and people moving about. The pictures and the outside of the hotel are a gross misrepresentation. I'd recommend staying elsewhere for better value.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Fraud in Pink and Beige”
Reviews.Author: pearjs9
Reviews.Content: It seams that the Concierge and the airport Limo service the hotel uses have a side business in copying customer credit cards. Once at the aiport, the driver pulled out an old fashioned carbon paper card imprinter for payment. Few days later the card company called to report strange transacations. It did not take them long pin point that copy location was the Metropolitan Hotel. This speed would indicate that this was probably not the first time. Aside from that , tiny old worn out pink, beige and gold trim room with a semi working air conditioner. Price was not outrageous but a bit high for the room quality. Perhaps its the location, location, location....

Reviews.Title: “Everything was just right.”
Reviews.Author: josch1122
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well managed, with friendly efficient staff. A good location in downtown Toronto. The hotel is clean and neat.

Reviews.Title: “It could be better”
Reviews.Author: juliemas
Reviews.Content: The hotel should be rated three star, There was no king bed available although we booked for one. We were given queen bed instead, The hotel loby has been renovated, the restaurant looks good, but the room needs some upgrade. The bedroom is rated no more than three star. Noisy air conditioned, relatively small. We did not use their facilities at all. The hotel location is very close to a subway, close to Eaton centre, and surrounded by restaurants. If the purpose to stay is for sleeping only, then its OK.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Good As They'd Like You to Believe”
Reviews.Author: OttawaNYFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in January 2011. While its location in downtown Toronto is convenient, it is not as great a hotel as they would like you to believe. I was upgraded to a junior suite (though I didn't ask for it) and I found the room and the bathroom small and dark. I didn't use the living room at all. In the very late evening, the fire alarm went off. I looked out the window and saw a number of emergency vehicles in front of the hotel. After the alarm went on, there were a series of repeated announcements to listen to further instructions. None ever came. I called the front desk and was told to listen to the announcements. Finally i went downstairs to join the many who were already down there. When we got to the bottom of the stairs, a hotel staff person did not know what to do with us, as the exit door was locked. He eventually took us out through the kitchen (not a pleasant experience). When the all-clear was sounded, none of the hotel staff could figure out how to get the elevators off of service and back working. There were a lot of tired and disgruntled people left standing in the non-moving elevators and in the hallway. The breakfast was equally disappointing - extremely pricey and nothing out of the ordinary. On check out, when I mentioned to the front desk staff that there should be some compensation/consideration for the inconvenience of the night before, I was snarled at.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Metropolitan”
Reviews.Author: MosephGoseph
Reviews.Content: We were staying in Toronto for a couple of days on a road trip and found this hotel to be quite nice and convenient in location. We could walk to anything we wanted to do. The hotel was clean and the indoor pool/hot tub were very nice. The only two things that we could say which are negative is that the wirless signal in our room was bad and when we called to ask about it they told us to sit by the door to get a better signal. The other is that we added a night to our stay and they told us to go online to reserve the room so we could get a better rate but we didn't know you have to print out the confirmation and then the business office was closed so it was a bit of a inconvenience but nothing major. We'd stay here again if we were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Space and Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HOW2MAX
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be one of our favorites. The service is amazing they really go out of their way. We had a suite and were very pleased with the size. The beds are very comfortable and the pillows are to die for! The parking/breakfast special is worth the extra cost. We stayed twice in one month and plan for a third next business event.

Reviews.Title: “Liked Public Space and Staff and restaurants but the rooms need to be redone”
Reviews.Author: brooklinerob
Reviews.Content: I traveled to interview clients, I was impressed with the public spaces and restaurant of the hotel. The rooms were a bit outdated and the bed and pillows most definitely needed to be replaced. The rate was attractive and the staff was top notch. For a 4 star hotel where you may want to interviews I would recommend it. Wait for a refresh of the rooms if you are looking for comfort. They do have a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a 5-star”
Reviews.Author: waswas32
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel located very close to the Eaton Center. The rooms are clean and well maintained, staff is friendly, courteous and helpful. The dining room offers an excellent menu for breakfast, lunch and dinner and the food is beautifully presented and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Samaras74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two night on our trip to Toronto and would recommend the hotel. the location is excellent for Yonge St & Dundas as well as the attractions on Queen St West. The staff were very professional and friendly and our room was serviced twice during our stay. The room itself was large with modern and attractive decor. The heating system was a little dated but not a significant factor. Overall we would definitely stay here again on our next visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Business Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: arjaydobleyoo
Reviews.Content: Located a five minute cab ride north of the central business district, this business hotel provides spacious accommodation. The lobby is uninspiring, and the location of the elevaters confuses guests. The restaurant feels better, the included breakfast buffet is good, but food from the menu is somewhat mediocre. The heat in my room didn't work properly, and the room stayed cold. I called maintenance, they responded quickly, and from then on it was satisfactory. Overall, nothing special but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great common areas, poor rooms.”
Reviews.Author: SomnioAmo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work a few times and was always quite pleased with the hotel's location and proximity to various happenings downtown. The main common areas of the hotel are very nice, modern and stylish...but once you enter your room, you feel like you have walked into grandma's country cottage. Tacky, not luxurious or classy. The staff also seems to be hit-or-miss. I would recommend booking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “not going back ever”
Reviews.Author: ElaBizz
Reviews.Content: First you would expect something good from the Metropolitan...well not at this location. I rarely write anything really negative but this hotel just got to me. This is an outdated hotel. Old carpet, old bathroom, outdate decor, outdated heating system...the only good thing: the pillows. For the rest you have a depressing view of an appartment building rented by hoarders...only view of clutter and dirty windows.The noise is unbeleivable because of the many delivery trucks passing by that street... As soon as you walk in it is a depressing feeling that gets to you: the old pink wallpaper is faded...patched in certain areas in the bathroom. The entire feeling when you are a business traveller gives you regrets not to be sleeping at home. I found absolutely no comfort in that hotel. And BTW...the cheap cheap cheap hairdryer just killed whatever hope I had to waking up in a good mood.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: asty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week with a group of colleagues. We all had a great time! I had read the reviews before we left, and as an avid Trip Advisor user was actually concerned. Yes our room was a bit dated. The decor reminded me of an old fashioned English Guest House. The room was immaculate and the bed was really comfy, which is what you need after a really busy day. The bar staff were great, as was the lad at reception. We also enjoyed our breakfast, there was enough choice and help kick start the day. We did eat a meal in the bar one evening and the quality was very good. The location was great, we walked most places in easy time. Dick and Dom were staying at the hotel at the same time, which was fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lisalisa77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel Toronto as I needed a nice hotel in the Downtown area. The location could not be beat, a few blocks from the Eaton Centre and AGO. The service was fantastic, all the staff members had a smiling face and went above and beyond to help in any way possible and make suggestions. The room was very clean and the bed was super comfortable, slept like a baby! The Hotel has some great restaurants as well. I would definitley recommend this hotel to anyone who needs a nice hotel in a great location Downtown. I shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Beautiful Lobby & Elevators but...”
Reviews.Author: SCBlossom
Reviews.Content: The staff was outstanding and could not have done a more oustanding job! They were helpful and friendly. The lobby and the elevators were beautiful. The painted silk panels in the elevators were a nice touch. The small rooms were very dated and definately need updating. I could almost tell you the month and year they were last done. The green carpet was faded, filthy and worn so that we wore socks rather than touch it. The peach colored vinyl wallpaper with the grey shell pattern in the bath made me think I was back in the 80s. The solid surface countertop in the bathroom had (probably a burn marked) sanded out and the tub had a black chipped area the size of a nickle. The sink stopper had a 5" white rubber stopper chained on to the loose faucet. The lighting was dim so doing reading and business work was very hard. The room was what you might expect along the freeway in the suburbs such as a La Quinta. The location is so perfect for where we needed to go that we might stay again or recommend it due to its location.

Reviews.Title: “OUR STAY WAS OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: JEL0927
Reviews.Content: A few years ago we stayed at the Metropolitan, and the room was not up to par, and things were left in the room and notes were put on our account. The hotel changed hands, to the better, and they honored our dismay about our last stay even though our notes did not follow to the new owners system. Vas was in charge of our reservation (Director of Front Office and Guest Services) and gave us a unbelievable rate due to our past experience. She certainly is an asset to the hotel. She out did herself with her customer service. We not only got a great rate, comp breakfast and free parking we got treated wonderful. Gail, at the front desk even upgraded us to a suite with our asking!!! Gail also went over and beyond. Friendly, polite and very accomdating. I would definately recommend this hotel to everyone. Food was good, bar service great, room was cleaned perfectly and Gail and Vas were so wonderful to work with. We are going to stay there in the summer to enjoy more of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Diappointed in my daughter's birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: mboyle
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice lobby and great location, but the rooms are old and worn. The pictures in the room were falling out of their old frames. The decor was definitely from the 80's. We were more disappointed in our stay though due to the front desk not being very hospitable. When I booked the rooms I told them my husband and I were bringing our daughter and her friend for a night in Toronto for her 17th birthday. I was very clear that the only thing we really cared about was a room together on a high floor so that their room would have a view of the city. She promised to mark that on our reservation We got to the hotel at 2 pm. We tried to check in but he said there were no rooms on the same floor together unelss we wanted the 5th floor. I asked him to check the reservation as we asked for a view and the 2 rooms on the same floor. Then he started saying we were checking in early and this is why. I asked if we waited until 3 would it make a difference. He said no, there's no guarantees. I thought mentioning my daughter's birthday and how all she wanted was a view of the lights in the big city might help but he couldn't care less. He eventually assigned us to 2 different floors and her view was of the other side of the hotel (or at least an equally high building). If that wasn't bad enough there were others checking in with other clerks and we culd hear they were being offfered whatever floor and view they wanted!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great after service care”
Reviews.Author: HamiltonBrent
Reviews.Content: This was my posted note of gratitude to the hotal for the after service I recieved. Feb 20 I checked out of Rm 814. I forgot a pair of Pj bottoms and a DVD in the DVD player. I called today (Feb. 21st) and asked Daryl at the Security office if the hotel had found them. Well he immediately determined they had the Pjs and he returned to the room for me immediately and found the DVD. Fortunately I was still in Toronto so I drove by and 20 minutes later I had the items returned. These were not valuable items which makes it even more impressive and me appreciative that your staff was contentious enough to turn in the pjs, and Daryl was immediately on the task to find the DVD. Many thanks to you and your staff for the extra effort. It is noted and I am grateful. Sincerely, Brent

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the AGO”
Reviews.Author: cinderella50
Reviews.Content: If you are in Toronto to visit the Art Gallery of Ontario, this hotel is a good choice. Park in the parking garage and walk to the gallery. We got a free upgrade which was appreciated. The king sized bed was very comfy - nice pillows and white sheets over the duvet which many hotels do now and it's much appreciated. The only quibble I have is the $8.00 "facility" fee for the wifi, water bottles and free local calls. The hotel should inform of this fee upfront, not at check out. And why not just incorporate the fee into the price. Other than that, good hotel, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a few problems”
Reviews.Author: Yappa
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel very much, and have stayed several times when visiting Toronto. The service is excellent. There is a very nice bar and a fabulous Chinese restaurant. Best of all is the bedding: great sheets, down comforters, down pillows... everything on the bed is clean and white (no bedspreads). The rooms are lovely and tasteful, with framed Chinese textiles on the walls. Some people have called the decor dated, but I think it's charming; it's boutique hotel style, rather than the sleek big corporate hotel look. But there are a couple of things that I wish the hotel would fix. One is the parking garage. At the bottom of the first ramp from the street, can they not put up a sign telling guests which parking entrance to use? I drove to one entrance, only to see a little sign that it was for condo residents. I backed up and drove up to the next entrance, only to see it was a dead end. Finally I went to the right entrance - not even a small sign indicating that it was for the hotel. Secondly, the breakfast buffet is decidedly sub-par. In a hotel of that quality you expect something more. The food is about the quality of a free breakfast in a cheaper hotel. Unripe fruit, cheapo cheese, crummy pastries, poor bread choices, icky sausages... the coffee wasn't even hot. And it's expensive. They need more selection, and they need higher quality food. (Especially for the price they charge.)

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Natcat64
Reviews.Content: The room size was very small and the decor was outdated with pink stucco walls, flowered curtains and beige trim. The walls needed repair and the carpet was stained. But the worse was the noice coming from the utility room next to mine which prevented me from sleeping. I reported it to the front desk the next mornign and was told they they would locate me in another room next time. There was no mention of actually fixing the problem. Great location and friendly staff are the positive points. The rate was also decent for a central downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “An alternative, but lacking the edge”
Reviews.Author: tablank
Reviews.Content: The stay was for a 2 day business meeting at one of the Hotels conference rooms. Let's start there, amenities and set-up of the conference room was sub-standard to start with, staff not available when needed, everything a bit improvised rather than well greased. The rooms aren't bad, but rather than having a nice living room that the traveler rarely needs, why not spend a bit more money on the bathrooms? Maybe we are too spoiled for choice in Asia, but the North American standard of bathrooms reminds me of the 70s and YMCA here. Anyway, the bed was OK, but somehow sleep was difficult, either too soft or too hard. The Restaurant had a basic menu and the food was good. Service in general was acceptable, the exception was the very friendly waiting staff at the restaurant. Location is good with many shops and Restaurants in walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Good Location,Freindly service”
Reviews.Author: t0nym14
Reviews.Content: Our stay for one night too see a leafs game. The hotel was very clean, hotel staff very helpful. A bit overpriced for our stay but worked well because of location. Parking lot is realtivly low, so if you have a truck and have access to a car, bring a car. About 1/2" of room from the truck to pipes/duct work and is a very tight parking lot. we walked to the cn tower in about 25 mins, the eaton centre is about 2 minutes away. The hotel room we stayed in (506) was quite small and outdated but the pillows were extremely comfortable/bed so worked for one night. There wasn't much of a view as we were only couple stories up. The pool area was clean but the hot tub seemed mildly cold for a hot tub. we took the bus down to the acc and cab back. The cab was 10 bux one way which I thought was pretty good. All in all the staff is very curtious and location was close enough for where we were going in town. we had arrived early and were able to check in at 1pm instead of 3pm which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but over priced for the quality”
Reviews.Author: ECL100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really well located, tight in the centre of the city so great for shopping/sightseeing. It is however, rather dated and quite expensive given the quality of the rooms. Ours had stains on the bathroom walls, the net curtains were dirty and the room generally needed a good deep clean. However, the staff were very friendly and helpful. We were a bit surprised to discover that having paid for our room in advance by prebooking through a website, we were then expected to pay 8 dollars per day to cover the use of the facilities in the hotel e.g. the gym. This might not seem a lot, but if you are on a tight budget and staying a few days, it is an expense you would not have accounted for.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, lousy shower and handy location.”
Reviews.Author: Marcie61
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to shopping, Hockey Hall of Fame, theatres, Chinatown, Textile Museum. TD Gallery of Inuit Art (free) and the AGO. Many restaurants nearby. "House of Gourmet Seafood, BBQ Noodle, Congee" 484 Dundas St. West. Cheap and delicious. Few blocks further west from AGO and across the street. Bed was really comfortable, but room was uncomfortably warm and could hear doors slamming. Shower was erratic. Counter staff was very welcoming and helpful. Airporter Express just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke infested, utterly unacceptable room”
Reviews.Author: YellowApple
Reviews.Content: For my wedding, I booked a room for my mother-in-law-to-be at the Metropolitan. We picked her up at the airport and went to check her in. We were informed that they were 100% full and only had a smoking rooms left, even though we had requested non-smoking. We were informed that preferences were never guaranteed. My MiL being gracious said as long as it was clean, it would be fine for one night, because the hotel promised that they were expecting check-outs and could offer her a non-smoking room for the rest of her one week stay. The room was absolutely unacceptable. It wasn't a "smoking room", it was filthy. The cigarette smoke fumed into the hallway the moment we opened the door. It was choking. Had the smell been anything but cigarettes,say air freshener or perfume, it would have been overwhelming causing coughing and choking, but we were told by the hotel staff that because it was cigarette smoke in a smoking room, it somehow made it okay. They were unwilling to put us up at any other affiliated hotel, saying everything in the city was booked or refund us for the night. We ended up having her stay with us in our one bedroom condo. The room should never have been offered. It was disgusting. We understand that smoking rooms still exist, but they should still be required to be clean. Clean should mean that the smell in the room is tolerable to the average person, but this was beyond reason. The treatment we received, where the staff were completely unhelpful and unwilling to refund the night or even offer a discount for a room they admitted wreaked of smoke (but that it was okay because it was a smoking room), was totally unacceptable. I strongly advise against staying at a place where they would ask their clients to stay in such accommodations and then offer no discount or reimbursement when they refuse.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; good location”
Reviews.Author: blt100
Reviews.Content: We had a good sized room on the 18th floor - it was very comfortable. We enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi. The staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 31Taffman
Reviews.Content: October 20 - November 1st From the very warm welcome by the reception team, the quick check in [and out], the excellent support services offered by the Concierge team We were quickly made to feel at home. The quality of customer service was high Our experiences of the room service teams on the 9th floor, were second to none. The room was very efficiently cleaned each day and the staff paid meticulous attention to detail. The in house Laundry service team, also need a mention. Many of the clothes we sent down for Laundering, returned in pristine condition, as if they were brand new. This was very much appreciated. We ate a few meals in the Bistro, the food was indeed top notch and many thanks must go to those working in the kitchens who provided food to such a high standard. Finally, we will most certainly be returning to Toronto as a result of our experience at the Metropolitan Hotel. We are more than willing to recommend the hotel to anyone who is considering visiting toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mamodDublin_ireland
