Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in September 10.The room was very small There was a big king size bed that took over the room , a wardrobe with a TV, an Ironing board ,1 dressing gown,& 2 racks to put your cases on( if you could find some where to put them in the room) all these were in the wardrobe,You had to sid on the bed to watch the TV.with the door open.That was room 1 823 There was a guy selling trips at the reception desk but did not tell you very much about the hotel you had to find out for yourself, The day we were leaving we found there was a swimming pool in the hotel,,The hotel is in the centre of down town near all the shops & young Street.We went on a 3 night trip to Niagara falls( see seperate Report ) & when we came back to this hotel they put us in a different room much bigger so we could move around put our clothes in the wardrobe ect ect,& nice view of down town Room 2418,The City was very nice we went to see Parlament house to see the moument of the battel of Rigway,University district, little Italy, Portugal village,China town,Kensington Market, CN Tower,Eaton Centre,Rogers Centre,There is so much to see in this City we also visit some watering holes.all in all we had a lovely time in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TitaMerello
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan Toronto is a very good hotel: clean, quiet, and with a professional staff. The location is excelent and in comparison with other hotels in the area, it is a great value. Check-in was fast, the room was big and well-kept, and the hotel is well-maintained. Everyone seemed very nice and professional. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: walaBarbados
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon here. The front desk assistant immediately upgraded our room complimentary on hearing we were on our honeymoon, and gave us vouchers for free breakfast for our entire stay, The rooms were clean, the beds comfortable and the staff friendly. Checkout was very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: NovaScotiaSailer
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in hotel, had stayed many times in past on business but not for about 8 years which is about the same time that the rooms had been cleaned last. The carpets were disgusting the bathroom dirty latch on door broken off holes in walls etc, we were stuck on the elevators 3 times as they started flashing error codes bypassing floors. They also did not honour room rate that was booked online on their site.....other than convenient location I would recommend to stay away, obviously they had no concerns for repeat business

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great city views and lovely room”
Reviews.Author: sandramurray1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great value and its in a v.good central location. Its v.handy for the Eaton Centre, tour buses, tourist info, and v.easy to get to and from the airport as the airport bus stops just across the road. Its a long walk to the CN Tower, but can be done. We got an upgraded room, for our 4 night stay, which was a lovely surprise. Ended up in an Executive room, and we had amazing views of the CN tower and the city. The room was huge, with King size bed, living room and 2 bathrooms. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tendring_wanderer
Reviews.Content: Quiet hotel close to the Eaton centre and Dundas square but the CN tower and the waterfront are too far to walk. The airport express bus stops opposite the hotel. We had been allocated a smoking room but this was quickly changed to a (slightly smaller) non smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value downtown”
Reviews.Author: OttawaWanderer05
Reviews.Content: Looking for an excellent location with good services in Toronto? A good choice is the Metropolitan Hotel on Chestnut. The standard rooms are not large nor do they offer a fridge or mini bar. But they are clean and everything works and in minutes you can be strolling on Yonge Street or in Chinatown or hopping on an inter-city bus. I also liked the exercise room and pool. This was my second stay this year and I would defintely go back for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GilloEssex
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Metropolitan for 2 nights over the weekend. We parked underneath the hotel with no problems (glad hubby was driving as it's very tight!!!!) and checked in perfectly well. The room was spacious (we had a delux room) and the bed was HUGE! In the morning we LOVED the breakfast - so many dishes to choose from. We were able to walk easily to the subway and could access different parts of town with ease. It also has the bonus of a gym and swimming pool!

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jaykay99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metropolitan on a work trip - excellent location for that purpose, and otherwise (close to Yonge/Dundas, AGO, TTC). Room was a bit of a let down - old carpet, outdated decor, cramped space with a king-size bed - but very clean, and the bed was really comfortable. The hotel was quiet at night. What I was looking for in a hotel was location and a place to sleep - and for that purpose the Metropolitan was just fine. Reasonable rates for downtown Toronto. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not like the pictures at all! Its like staying in the country inn that your Grandma decorated!”
Reviews.Author: shaigal
Reviews.Content: do not stay at this hotel. I was on their website checking out the hotel and the rooms before i booked. I stayed 2 nights and paid $350 dollars for what i thought was a nice 4* hotel with modern interior. When we got there it was an old dingy hotel room with old oak doors, pink carpet and pink floral drapes and covers! the room was so small we couldnt even put both our suitcases down because there was no space to walk. When i went to front desk to complain about the room they just blew me off and did not care about the money I have spent at their hotel. When i tried to complain to the hotel because their website is completely misleading and its completely false advertising. Also, its not in the best part of the downtown core. Be very careful if you do deciede to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reception Didn't have enough seatings! Dirty Common Toilet!”
Reviews.Author: Abdul28
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 night and I was really dissapointed with the Reception as it didn't have enugh chairs and just oozed some negative energy for some reason. The Reception were not very freindly and I had to wait for a really long time! The Hallways were very tight and un-spacious with nothing good to look at, the decoration was under-average and had a really deprissing feel to it. The Rooms were ok. The location was very Good though , It's safe hence it's close to the police station, It's also close to China Town. The Bus Boy was freindly gotta give'em that . Not Saying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Refuge from our Labour of Love”
Reviews.Author: Daddy43
Reviews.Content: My wife and her family were about to head to Mt. Sinai for what we though was to be a regular planned delivery of our first child. This was July 16, 2010. The result was anything but normal or smooth. Long story short the 3 days at the hospital prior to delivery was hectic, chaos, all crammed in one room waiting and waiting. We had in the past stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel and decided we needed a suite for a night to have a place where we could take turns resting. One phone call and the staff arranged our suite, and for the next three nights we would escape one at a time to grab some zzzz''s and even dine downstairs for breakfast on a couple days. The rooms were amazing, clean, comfortable, staff was superb in providing the little things we needed or forgot to bring. Location is fantastic. Food was so tasty. And price, given what we mentioned we were in town for, they even arranged a special price for us. I have to say, without The Metropolitan, we all would have had a nervous breakdown. In the end we had our bundle of joy and would recommend this hotel and restaurant hands down to anyone !

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable. No frills.”
Reviews.Author: MNJenRN
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night during midweek. Service was friendly and efficient. Our room was on the 10th floor and we had a fantastic view of the CN Tower. The room was spotless and the bed very comfortable. I was worried it would be too loud as we were near the elevator, but I didn't hear anything and slept well. The parking is great with in and out privileges. Didn't try the restaurants. The hotel itself just feels a bit outdated in the room and lobby, but overall a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: LifeCoachontheMove
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan for one week in mid June. We had a room on the 22nd floor. We found the conceirge staff very helpful and friendly, particularly Jing, Eduardo and Gavin. Most of the other guests were either police drafted in for the G20 or large travelling groups from Europe? The breakfasts were tasty and filling, costing $14 per person. We would recommend this hotel for its location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction of The Metropolitan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karankero
Reviews.Content: Metropolitan Hotel is a one of the most famous and one of the most brilliant hotels in the heart of the Toronto Downtown. This hotel has almost everything and also has a very reasonable price for everthing. Its location also is very chermendous. You can experience the beautiful and high buildings of Toronto like the CN Tower. This hotel is near to the subway station and the bus stand. Also Metropolitan Hotel has very nice service. The helping staff and the managers are very kind and most importantly very helpful. The food is just delicious. This hotel has a very wide variety of menu from all parts of the world especially south asian. On the whole, we were very impressed by the service and the friendliness of the hotel staff and most importantly the facilities like spa and gym and many more. I would recommend this hotel to all the people who are visiting Toronto. You will not find a hotel like this for such a reasonable price and high quality!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the room”
Reviews.Author: SherbutFizz
Reviews.Content: I'd read several of the other reviews before we went and wasn't sure about this hotel despite our travel agent recommending it. It was in an excellent location just off Yonge/Dundas Square and the room had a great view of the CN Tower. It's a shame because it had everything a good hotel should have and the public areas were lovely , very clean and well presented but the rooms (and we saw two because the first had a very funny smell!) are in desperate need of updating - really rather shabby, grubby carpets and mouldy tiling in the bathroom... not one I'd recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, food & location at good price”
Reviews.Author: annieair
Reviews.Content: use this hotel whenever i am am in or near this part of TO. The staff is always excellent; unlike majority of hotels the food is excellent. Rooms are not large but certainly adequate with work space, cahair etc & linens are excellent quality - as are the pillows. The bathrooms are small & dated but can live with that. Walking distance to theatres, shopping as well as most major TO hospitals & many businesses.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LeeJoMaldives
Reviews.Content: Ok, so you won't be impressed with the dated features of this hotel but the positives outweigh the negatives unless maybe you are paying full price and then you may well disagree with me. The location is perfect for tourists and business people alike. Only a 5 minute walk from China town and the large Younge and Dundas square. The Eaton Centre for shopping is also only 5 min away. I stayed here for 14 nights on business and I have to say the service was good, the free wifi was good and the pool and gym were OK. I didn't dine in the restaurants but they did look good, although quite pricey compared to the vast eateries in the area. If you are wanting a good base to explore Toronto then this is a good option but if you are looking for 5* and something romantic then you should maybe consider alternatives first.

Reviews.Title: “What's with all the hate? I LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sauceykat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2006 (not 2007) just for one night. I booked a standard room and was upgraded to an Executive Suite, so my review is based on my experience in their best suite. I arrived late at night from the Caribbean and was exhausted, but the staff were super friendly and helpful. The kitchen was closed, unfortunately, and I hadn't eaten all day and was craving a pizza (after a month digging in the Caribbean) and I was dirty and not exactly dressed like someone that should be upgraded to a suite, but the staff were SO FRIENDLY and accommodating and helped me order a pizza (God, how I miss Pizza Pizza in Ontario!). The room was AMAZING, best sleep I ever had in a hotel except maybe the Sofitel de la Cloche in Dijon. It took me a couple minutes to realize that what I thought was my room was just the sitting room (jetlag/cultureshock much? LOL) and the door at the end of the hall lead to a big beautiful bedroom with the most comfortable king sized bed, and amazing view, and a second washroom! I don't really understand the bad reviews here, but then again maybe because I was staying in a higher class room that I had a better experience (I was under the impression the hotel was renovated ca. 2005 so I don't know why ppl say it's outdated--I'm assuming by the pics posted that perhaps they did not renovate the standard rooms?). Frankly, for the price difference, you're better off upgrading to at least a class above standard. I'm visiting Toronto again in a couple weeks and have booked the Exec. Suite again for 3 nights (check out their Stay for 3, Pay for 2 deal--it's basically the same price as a Std. room for 3 days!) and I will post an updated review then. A tip to all travelers from someone who worked (briefly) at a hotel: don't bother with the auction sites or third party sites, you're usually better off to book directly through the hotel (websites usually have the best deals) or ask for their best rates (the first rate offered on the phone is the "rack" rate, or full price). You might pay a little more extra, but hotels get very little from the third party sites (often much much less than half the rack rate) and will assign you the least desirable rooms (next to the elevator or in a noisy area), and won't be very helpful if you want to change rooms. Not to mention, you usually have to deal directly with the 3rd party site if you have any issues or need to cancel!

Reviews.Title: “Made up for a rough start...”
Reviews.Author: vealaw1
Reviews.Content: Friends and I booked our room a few days before we needed to stay. It was last minute, but we booked directly through the hotel's website and were confirmed a room with two double beds. When we got to the hotel, we were told they didn't have any available and "did we book through a third party?" We did not, so they tried to upgrade us to a deluxe room, but had none available. Finally, they put us in an executive suite which was beautiful. It had 2 full bathrooms (something 3 women desperately need), was very clean and while we only had a king and a pullout couch, it was still a great room. We had no problems with anything mentioned below (noise, smell, etc). Our room was clean and the staff was friendly and gave us some great recommendations for restaurants. The hotel is very close to China Town and within a short cab ride to a lot of great areas of Toronto. We walked down to the lake one day and also to the Hockey Hall of Fame. Location was nice. The hotel parking garage was full and we had to park across the street but didn't have any problems there either. Oh, and the sangria in the hotel bar is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Toilet Flushes and Buses”
Reviews.Author: TravelManitoba
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it depends on where your room is and what side of the building you are on but my room on the 4th floor was rather disappointing. Simply put, I couldn't sleep. I could hear toilets flushing all night long. Not just a flush sound but a loud WWWWHHHHHOOOOOOSSSSSHHHH sound just like you might hear if you decided to sleep with your head on a toilet seat. The noise from buses, which I later assumed to be heading to the Toronto Coach Terminal just up the street and around a corner, helped make it an even better stay. I stayed a second night without changing my room. I was so tried I didn't want to go through with the hassle of a room change and figured that I would sleep well because I was so exhausted. I fell asleep early only to be awaken by a telephone call at 10:30pm. A polite gal from the front desk responded to my quite "hello" with an inquiry as to whether I would like a wake up call for the morning. I informed her that this call sufficed and I wouldn't need another in the morning. This led to another long night of toilet flushes and buses. Other than that, the decor is a bit dark and somewhat old as others have indicated but it is a good central location. The swimming pool is good along with the fitness center. If you stay here, I'll hope you do not get the room I had on the 4th.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at the Met”
Reviews.Author: MikeToulman
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Metropolitan and really had a great stay. The service staff is very helpfull and professional, the hotel itself is ideally located. I enjoyed the food in the restaurants and chilled next to the swimming pool! I will definitely come back

Reviews.Title: “Everything perfect...except for the room itself”
Reviews.Author: joff88
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Metropolitan last week and found almost everything to be perfect for this price range. The staff were great, the restaurants were fantastic, the location was excellent and the room was housekept very well. The only downside was the room itself. As previous people have mentioned the decor was VERY dated....our Queen room had pink walls, big old TV and floral curtains. Kind of reminded me of my Grandma's house. Having said that everything else was fine, so didn't really care. I was in Toronto for a holiday - not to hang around in my room all day! Someone mentioned the speed of the internet there....yes it was slow but it wasn't that bad in the business centre (which they let me use free of charge after hours).

Reviews.Title: “Works fine as a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: P_Stibbons
Reviews.Content: I was on a two-night business trip, and for my purposes, the hotel worked out fine. All my three business venues were in walking distance, and I found ample sights close by to make a stroll around the area worth while. Some of the fittings and equipment are basic, but functional. The restaurant was pleasant and the food attractive, though somewhat on the expensive side. Service was prompt and helpful - I had to change some things, and they were accommodating without making a fuss.

Reviews.Title: “you get you money's worth”
Reviews.Author: brygida
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant in booking this hotel due to some reviews ,but for the time of booking to the time of check out it was nothing else but a nice experience. We stayed in different hotels in Toronto and this one has a very special team of people that makes your stay awesome. Restaurant in the hotel is excellent and well priced. The hotel is well situated and very clean. Rooms are small but super comfy and clean. I would go back anytime. Good job and thumbs up for the hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller067
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was old and smelly. The cleanliness of the hotel is sub par and the rug in my room was damp. The rooms are out dated and the hotel is in need of a complete renovation. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: WendyAM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for two nights on business. Arrived on Sunday and despite being before the 3pm check in time, I was found a room I could check into straight away. I was worried that it was a little close to the elevators and ice machine, but I didn't hear either. The room wasn't huge but it was fine. Queen sized bed which was comfortable. Duvet a little thin but pillows very good. Bathroom was a bit small but functional. Shower had different pulse heads. Good supply of hot water. Toiletries felt cheap which is always a disappointment. Also, despite almost finishing the shower gel on day 1, it wasn't replenished for my second night which was stingy, I think. Hair dryer more powerful than it looked though it was one of those which were confined to the bathroom. Iron and ironing board in the closet. Small closet but enough hanging space. Drawer unit, desk, nightstands/bedside tables, three lamps. Oh, how I hate not havng overhead lighting in the bathroom or bedrooms these days. Like being a cave dweller. Glad to be able to open the window to get fresh air. Within walking distance - albeit about 2km - from the CN Tower. Friendly desk and other staff. Would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location and service in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: WaziMom
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Metropolitan are a bit faded -- in terms of wallpaper and rickety wardrobe, it's time for a revamp. But it is spotlessly clean, bed linens were fine, soft, immaculatey clean; bathroom is old-fashioned but perfectly workable and clean -- and the staff service and friendliness, along with the location, are nearly unsurpassable. Our visit was to museums and friends, and we could walk or take public transport speedily and easily everywhere we needed to go with absolutely no difficulties. It's 30 seconds (really!) from the wonderful Textile Museum (whose shop is a goldmine!) and about 5 mins max from the AGO. It's surrounded by Asian and other restaurants from cheap and cheerful to all price points and the concierge and other staff will cheerfully make recommendations and offer directions. There is valet parking and staff helped us do such things as retrieve a lost cell phone and run various errands with always a smile and sincere helpful attitude. See separate review of the excellent Lai Wah Heen resto for their dim sum. Breakfast buffet is Western, good but not outstanding; but certainly convenient. I would highly recommend this hotel and could only wish for another trip to Toronto to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “YUCK!”
Reviews.Author: IoannaAtHome
Reviews.Content: In reading some of these reviews I got worried on the condition of the room we would be staying in. I called the hotel the day before I arrived to make sure the room was clean and recently updated and not like these rooms i saw on the internet that people posted pics of. My husband and i stayed in what was called "the luxury king suite". The lady told me on the phone it had been renovated in the last 3 years and made me feel a little better about staying there. Frankly, it was smelly, the carpets were stained, we kept our shoes on, and i put a book on the chair to sit on it. No bed bugs i checked. For a king size bed my husband and i swore it was a Queen. Small and we were uncomfortable. Really, Really Small. For one night 180 dollars, felt like it should have been 50 dollars. Cable TV is brutal. I will never, never stay there again. They should have invested the money for the rooms guests sleep in then their grand foyer. We got the breakfast included, Powered eggs YUCK!, the sausage was not that good, everything else in the buffet was okay. All in all my final reveiw, YUCK, YUCK, YUCK! In the future i will stick with the hotel that gave me a good experience, clean, roomy, nice view, awesome awesome beds and thats the Westin Harbour Castle. Go there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel - would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveller37
Reviews.Content: Great location. Quick check in. Elevators always arrived quickly. The rooms are dated but clean. Two suitcase stands in our room (great!). Internet was pretty slow and weak signal, but it was free and I still got a lot of work done online. Didn't eat in hotel as there are lots of restaurants on Dundas Street West. Workout facility was pretty simple (four treadmills, crosstrainer and small free weights) but clean, lots of towels and cold water. Change room/washrooms clean, too. The adjacent pool had lots of seating and a whirlpool. Underground parking lot pretty tight, but well lit.

Reviews.Title: “Garbage breeds garbage...”
Reviews.Author: roggiec565
Reviews.Content: The day I checked in, the entire lobby smelled like sweage! The front desk mentioned it was from a backup in the elevator shaft. Yikes! Went to our "deluxe' room that looked like it was from a bad 80's movie. The decor was very dated and worn. There were even cigarette burns in the carpet and a cracked toilet in the bathroom that hadn't been replaced? They advertise comp wi-fi but then they sucker you into paying a facilities fee which BTW is a rip-off! I''ve had better stays at a motel 6 then this hole in the wall! Run to the next hotel but avoid this dump like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: homeandaway_10
Reviews.Content: Perhaps there are rooms in the hotel that are nice - the one we stayed in, wasn't one of them. The smell of the room was horrible and the decor was dated.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for the Money in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: gwilliams
Reviews.Content: I agree with some of the other reviews here that the hotel is a bit tired, and needs to be spruced up. But for value for money it is the best downtown Toronto deal. The local competition is the Sheraton (more expensive, and in addition charges for internet service), the Marriot (usually much more expensive), and some cheaper hotels (which are cheap in more ways than just cost). Most of the time you can get a queen bed in a comfortable room here for $125 on the internet, plus taxes. The Sheraton is about $25 more and charges $19 a night for internet for a comparable room. Parking charges? I don't drive to downtown TO, so can't compare, but both hotels are a hop and a skip from the City Hall's underground parking. And the Metropolitan is closer to more interesting dining (including, if you want to splurge, the best high end Chinese dining room in the city).

Reviews.Title: “horrible rooms and horrible tasting new lunch and supper menu”
Reviews.Author: MISSPICO
Reviews.Content: myself and a friend came to this hotel thinking it would be a pleasurable experience has it has many times in the past , Alot of money has been spent in this hotel over the years from myself and friends.we were greeted nicely at the front door by all the familiar faces that knew us from all the time we have spent there , the bellman are wonderful and they are the only thing left in that hotel that are good. we were placed in a dirty room at first , it was smoking room and it had looked like a hotel u would find in a beat up neighbourhood , not the metropolitan hotel . the carpets were black the curtains were ripped , there was scratches in the white sheers , it stunk really bad and the walls had mess all over them , it was like being placed in a bacterial world .I smoke at my home and i do not live in filth so why does a hotel that's smoking have to be worse then a pigs pen? After getting my business partners husband to call the hotel we finally got a room , but they had told us nothing better was available , imagine spending a hundred thousand or more there and being told there is no better room when in fact there was .the room they found us was ok but it was just adequate really , we were scared of the closet and we were scared to put our stuff on anything but our own luggage , its hard to see what you have in three suitcases when there's no where that feels safe to put your stuff. The menu used to be amazing and now it is a disgrace, breakfast was the only good meal we had there this time and breakfast is pretty much something that any place can get right even denny's , so that's no bonus for them . My friend had ordered us a huge feast from there in her suite one evening and it was alot of money for the food , it was one of the worst meals we had ever had there , and also all our favorite dishes were not on the menu any longer only to be replaced with the worst pasta and fish dishes ever , the chicken was gross and so was the soup , nothing that meal was good , it was shocking and it was completely offensive to have paid for such a meal like this. one of the fish meals we ordered the fish was not cleaned properly and it was alot of grizzle and not cooked at all like it should ,

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Radtrav
Reviews.Content: Good location for TO hospitals. Pleasant check-in. Adequate room. No problem with heat. Comfortable bed. Clean.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: ErinMarmoset
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel for a business trip in January 2008 and stayed 5 nights. I stayed in a room with one king bed. My training seminar was across the street from the university and had listed the Metropolitan as the nearest hotel. The location was nice. I'm from North Carolina and I'm not used to driving in the snow, so I was happy that there were great restaurants within easy walking distance. The hotels inside the restaurant were extremely overpriced and offered minimal vegetarian options. There was a fee for the parking, but it was covered and well maintained. The room itself was very disappointing. The first thing I noticed was the smell. The musty (not moldy) smell of the room was being covered up with a thick old-lady-perfume smell. The front desk was willing to send up an air purifier that helped a great deal, but each time I left the room housekeeping would retrieve the air purifier and the smell would return. I'm not a germaphobe...well, maybe a little, but the bed had a fabric headboard. I imagine that would be exceptionally difficult to clean, and I can't imagine it's cleaned on a regular basis. The shag carpeting, likely the source of the odor in the room, was very out of date and had long hairs (people hairs that is, I don't mean to say the carpet fibers were that long) in it that caught in my toes as I walked. I'm not sure these can be vacuumed out, but I imagined many people cleaning their hair brushes out while sitting at the foot of the bed. Ick. There were exactly two electrical outlets in the bedroom portion of the room (and an additional one in the bathroom vanity). Both electrical outlets had extension cords with multipliers in each one. Still, with all the plugs crowding the multipliers, there were no free outlets for me to charge my phone or laptop in the bedroom area. I was hesitant to put my phone (or computer) in the sink to charge.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs to be cleaned”
Reviews.Author: conandbob
Reviews.Content: Dirty carpet and rooms in poor repair and old. We travelled for a national organization and all had the same experience as a group. Seasoned travelers wouldn't even take their socks off. Washed sink before using and found all rooms dated and dirty feeling. Poor performance for Downtown TO!

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: AucklandGopo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it is very close to Ryerson University where my conference was held. From other reviews I was a bit doubtful about staying here, but had an enjoyable stay. I had a very quiet room at the end of a corridor on the 20th floor. The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. The bathroom was a bit small and dated with little room to put all my things, but the shower and bath were fine. The window drapes were good at keeping out the light from neon signs near Yonge-Dundas square. I had the buffet breakfast each morning and really enjoyed it. I ate in the bistro a few nights and had nice food and good service. Room service food was ok but not outstanding. From my window I could see a Christmas tree in a nearby square and people ice skating. I was within walking distance (?ten minutes) of Eaton Centre. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a comfortable stay in central Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Plesantly surprized and very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: nuncnunc
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel before reading any reviews.Then when we did read reviews we were very apprehensive. We called and emailed the hotel and they just suggested we come and judge for ourselves. I am so glad we did.All staff were very friendly and accomodating.Lobbt was beautiul and elegant. Our room was very clean and beds were top notch.Good quality sheets and duvets and pillows. Really comfy. Room was a decent size.Hotel location was perfect for shoppind dining and theatre and tourist attractions.Only one little negative was room could use a little decor update. Bedskirts,drapes.Would definetly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alainpothier
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference and stayed at this hotel from 25 to 27 Nov 09. The room is very small and does not have a fridge. The carpet was very dirty but in general the room cleanliness was ok, seen better. You could not park your car yourself so you have to use valet parking which is $26 per day. Very expensive - what's wrong with parking my car by myself and what's wrong with including parking with the room. Beware, They add an additional $8.00 per day on your bill for you daily 2 bottles of water and for the use of their small gym and swimming pool whether you use them or not. The hotel is well located, right downtown, very convenient. We did not eat at their restaurant because it was too expensive. Room service is exorbitant. We will never go again to that hotel - you can get better for less $$$ and bigger room with a fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Go2Girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room 1415 at the Metropolitan Hotel on November 24, 2009 while travelling on business. I paid a business rate of $113 / night. I arrived late (almost 10pm) due flight delays but was nonetheless promptly greeted by a very pleasant attendant at the check-in desk. My room was small, though entirely adequate for my purposes - a small wardrobe, a king-sized bed, a TV, a comfortable chair and desk. The wardrobe did make the entrance a bit cramped which made for an awkward moment when my dinner was delivered. (I had to hold the door open with one arm while backing into the bathroom so that the delivery guy could squeeze by me to set the tray on the bed.) The bed and pillows were, by the way, extremely comfortable and I enjoyed one of the best nights of sleep that I have ever had while staying at a hotel. On the downside, however, it's true that the hotel is a bit worn around some edges - marks on doors and walls in the hallway from luggage or furniture scuffing against them, slightly peeling wallpaper in certain corners. I also had to wait longer than I expected to check much luggage at the concierge desk in the morning, despite several attempts by the check-in/out staff to get the concierge's attention (he walked away, never to be seen again, after offering to take the luggage of the woman in line behind me?). However, the staff, level of service and comfort made for a very pleasant stay overall. The hotel is also extremely well located - right next to Toronto City Hall and Osgoode Hall (where I was attending a conference) and just a block from the Eaton Centre. I would definitely stay here again and am glad that I took the "risk" to try the Met out.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: memit
Reviews.Content: located in the heart of the city, clean, tidy and comfortable hotel with great breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous!!”
Reviews.Author: SquidAndBeans
Reviews.Content: For a downtown hotel in a major city this is extremely poor. There's not many positives to take from the hotel. Horrible lobby area, rude front desk staff and as for the rooms, OMG the rooms!! I moved once because of the smell from the room - it smelled so dirty and old! When I went down to ask for a room change they didn't even apologize - clearly it's not that uncommon I guess. My new room was only marginally better. Tiny, old, old, old furniture, TV, bathroom. Thankfully I didn't need to use the 'air conditioning' as it was incredibly noisy and, erm, old! Not a good hotel and would certainly not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Polish a Turd It's Still a Turd!!!”
Reviews.Author: AdrianeYos
Reviews.Content: The lobby was nice and I definitely made the mistake of judging a book by its cover. Check in was easy and quick. Came to the dated door with the room number looking like it was made in a paint it yourself pottery center. My initial reaction to this room was 'wtf did I pay for?' I was not impressed at all. I walked in and noticed the stained carpet and dated drapes. I opened the armoire and was shocked to find an old 19 inch television. I had an excellent view of what appeared to be student dorms across the way. At night I could literally hear the people above me and the AC/Heater next to the bed didn't help with the added noise. Then noticed they had the nerve to have bathrobes available and also for sale. Are you serious? I fortunately didn't partake of the in room dining so I was spared the extra money. The internet connection is terrible even if its free. The LAN line doesn't work so if you book this hotel you are going to be disappointed with that. The next morning I was awakened by this terrible noise which turned out to be the fire alarm. From 9am-10:30am it was a horrible noise. It was brought to the hotels attention that it was activated on the 12th floor I was on the 17th. So imagine that being your alarm clock if you planned to sleep in. This hotel is not worth being practically cheap over. Spend an extra $20 and book the Sheraton instead, you get a better standard room, flat screen and cleaner updated room and no hidden fees like this cardboard hotel. You would think that a hotel like this would be up with the times but it obviously is the biggest mistake I've ever made. Nice Things The Elevator The bathroom was the same as the Econolodge bathroom(go figure) Lobby is nice Wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. Yes THAT bad.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your carpet cleaner!!!”
Reviews.Author: JonandKarin
Reviews.Content: What can we say about the Metropolitan? First and foremost, this place is dirty and seriously needs to be refurbished. In fact, the receptionist informed us that the hotel hadn't been updated for 10 years!!! The first room we were allocated was simply awful, however after a little complaining and an almost free upgrade we moved to a newly decorated room. Much better but the finish wasn't particularly good and you still had to approach it along a dated corridor with stained carpets. It was a shame that we didn't have an opportunity to check TripAdvisor before booking as we'd not have stayed given the other reviews. Best not trust the Michelin Guide when it comes to this hotel ...! What else? The reception area wasn't particularly attractive and breakfast wasn't very good either. Oh and don't forget the hidden facilities charge of $8 per day (not including the typical 1000 taxes) covering the gym, internet access and a bottle of water. Great value as long as you use them!!! Unfortunately the rather rude lady who checked us out wouldn't remove the charge despite the fact that we hadn't made use of the "facilities". Even if they refurbished the whole hotel, we would NOT go back, not even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “my experience the opposite of most others on here”
Reviews.Author: Steven6008
Reviews.Content: Either the Metropolitan took the large majority of negative comments here to heart and improved their operation real fast or most people on here misidentified the hotel. I have nothing but good things to say about them in (almost) every respect. Granted the rooms could use a bit of a touch up, but they were still clean, attractive, roomy enough and very comfortable. Staff were all polite, although one or two of them a bit distant. Loved the perfectly central location and the breakfast buffet, which was also a better deal, especially with the "guest appreciation" discount, than b'fast at surrounding restaurants of same class. The only problem I had was a few weeks before I arrived, when I sent an e-mail to their reservations department requesting confirmation whether they had received my reservation made through a different website. I received a very terse refusal at first, sending me back to the source, from which I of course already had a confirmation and I had to request the hotel's confirmation 3 times, which was parcelled out to me in three terse, rude and sarcastic answers. That certainly did not bode well and when I read all the negative comments on here, I was prepared to have to do battle all the way during my stay, but from the moment I checked in, all went well and made up for any slights from the reservations department. If I can get the same deal again on the rooms, that I got through the other website, I'll go back again on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: Artistseye
Reviews.Content: This hotel is totally shabby and dated. The entry way is fine but that is where it ends. The hallways are dingy, smelly and have ceiling tiles missing. As far as the room I can understand a tiny room in a large city like this as that is the norm but this was just butt ugly. Worn ikea-esque furniture, cheap worn out carpet, tatty curtains, and the cheapest bathroom fixtures possible. The coffee maker had a big hole melted in the top of it and looked like it hadn't been rinsed in weeks. The window air conditioner was so loud it would wake us up every time it came out (sounded like a jet taking off outside). Not particularly clean either - bathroom obviously hadn't been well cleaned in a very long time, FILTHY windows, nasty carpet. The ONLY redeeming feature was the bed - very comfortable with good linens. Internet connection was out off and on the entire time (4 days) and calls to the front desk actually got a surprised response... that they were shocked we'd want them to do something about it. One morning it was obvious only one elevator was running - we had to wait several minutes and then rode down in a fully loaded elevator that stopped at almost every floor with many people waiting. Service was pathetic. The doorman never even bothered to open the doors even when we were loaded with bags. The bellman spent most of his time around the corner smoking or chatting up the other help. The only front desk person that was remotely professional was the trainee.... evidently not here long enough to be corrupted by the who cares attitude. We booked this hotel because of it's proximity to our work site but would walk 10 blocks the next time to avoid staying here. It really is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “So very dissappointed with the Downtown Metropolitan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancy102
Reviews.Content: Sept.2/09 my family member and I went to Toronto to see The Sound of Music. I had researched hotels online. Pictures of the rooms and hotel amenities were important. We chose the Metropolitan Hotel Downtown Toronto.The main lobby was presentable. The corridors looked clean, the staff very helpful. We opened the door to room 1908 and our first reaction was "I don't want to stay in this room tonight" . It was very unappealing. I went to the main desk to switch rooms.I asked where the bedspread was,and if the rooms were all this small. I was told the rooms were all the same and the duvet was under the sheet..Let me discribe the room to you...the carpet was old and bunched in a few spots(easy to trip), the bed had a sheet, a thin duvet and then another white sheet on top..(no bedspread), the 3 drawer dresser was very old, the bathroom counter was so tiny, the curtains didn't cover the window. We didn't invite our friends up to the room that night. The next morning the elevator wouldn't open on the Lobby floor-7 people stuck in the elevator for 45 minutes. The staff and manager treated us well. We had a free bkfst in the Hemisphere Rest. which was very nice. This was our treat in Toronto...we will Never stay in a Metropolitan again. So very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: timothy135
Reviews.Content: Made the trek up to Toronto for the Red Sox series and stayed August 18-21. Got a great rate of approximately 80 USD a night through easyclicktravel.com. Upon our arrival the valet and bell boy greated my fiance and I with attentive service. I will say the only gimmick run by this hotel is their parking. Not a big deal but the advertise self parking and when you arrive their is only valet available. Valet ran us 78 dollars for three nights and the valet service is 6 dollars more a night then self parking. They need to remove the self parking signs. There is a lot directly behind the hotel but the cost was not much less than the valet. We checked into our room on the 11th floor and thought the hotel room was much more than I/we expected. The hotel is located about 8 blocks from the Cn tower and rogers centre/ steam whistle brewery. Brewery and cn tower are must stops. Arrive at the brewery early as their tours fill up fast. All in all a great trip and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but otherwise average.”
Reviews.Author: 1066girl
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at the Metropolitan for a week. The best thing about the hotel was the location. It is close to everything and is in an area that is very safe to walk around at night. The worst thing was the breakfast which was not very nice. The first morning no one greeted us so we just sat down and assumed buffet service. The next six mornings we were introduced to the buffet service! I thought a bowl of cereal was in order but I found the milk was off, which was not very nice. I tried the waffles and pancakes, both very dry, so I needed a lot of maple syrup! The room was quite small and the beds were not that comfortable. The concierge were a bit hit and miss but mostly helpful. The desk staff were much the same really, the member of desk staff on checking in was very helpful but at other times they were very reluctant to help.

Reviews.Title: “Metropolitan, slight race issue”
Reviews.Author: Nodnoltravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a stay in 1998. The menu doesn't allow me to reflect accurate date. The hotel has all the facilities that you'd expect from a 4*. One particular member of staff, said in a surly and aggressive tone that "newspapers were for guest" only. Obviously the white guest who were reading thw newspapers, weren't met with that approach. A quick compliant ot the duty manager, and an apologie was made by him, not the trash woman who made the comment. Other than that the amenities were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanDiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the perfect location - close to major shopping/restaurants. The rooms were decent enough but DEFINITELY outdated. The room was so tiny. The hotel lobby was also outdated. I was expecting something a bit more modern and updated. One annonying issue was a daily charge of $8 for facility fees. We did not use any of the facilities -i.e. internet, pool etc and were not pre-advised of this fee or given the option to opt-out. A bit of a rip off - only noticed this when we checked out. Also, if you plan on using their parking lot - good luck - their parking lot was so tight and at times there was no parking available so we had to go through the whole parkade only to exit again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: PaErie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel for 2 nights as did our friends. Our opinion in a nutshell: Good: Rooms quiet & conducive to a good night's rest; beds were comfortable. We received an upgrade to a king bed. Not so good: Some concierge staff more helpful than others. Hotel charged us a nonsensical $8.00 per day 'facilities fee' on top of the "total package price" which we had confirmed to our Visa. Apparently 'total' doesn't really mean 'total.' We had to use more expensive valet parking as we were told 'regular' parking was "unavailable." Rooms are a bit 'tired' looking & have no refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, outdated hotel”
Reviews.Author: irahsirahs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan on a business trip. The room was tiny and only had a wall-unit air conditioning unit that didn't really work. It looked as if someone tried to make a very old room look modern by throwing in a new bed and some fresh sheets. The bathroom was old and dingy. When I checked in, the room they originally gave me smelled horribly of smoke. They did move me to another room. However, the internet connection never worked properly (a very important detail on a business trip). For almost $200 CAD per night, I was very disappointed. The bed was the only saving grace - it was very comfortable. There are some great Chinese/Taiwanese restaurants in the neighborhood, but I have a feeling it gets a bit "dicey" in the area later at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a warm and friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Fairyhobbit
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in July. The location of the hotel is good with just a 5 minute walk to the main centre/cinema/restaurants. The hotel was very easy to find but the staff were not so helpful when we arrived. The valet parking was very expensive so I would recommend looking up alternate parking close to the hotel. The restaurant in the hotel was very nice and the food very impressive. We stayed in a standard double room which was a little on the small side but clean and tidy. On the whole, a cheaper hotel than many around in Toronto and if you're looking for a place to sleep while spending most of the day/night exploring Toronto then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service and the room was not cleaned properly”
Reviews.Author: Char075
Reviews.Content: My stayed at this hotel was lousy. The hotel put me in a extremely small room that literally only fit a queen size bed right behind the elevator. When I called to let them know that I can hear the elevator from my room and asked for another room, they told me I would have to pay an additional $20 to upgrade. The rug was diry and stained. I accidentally dropped my liquid foundation bottle that shattered all over the bathroom floor. I did my best to wipe the floor but assumed the cleaning staff would do the rest. When I returned to my room at the end of the night, I can tell they didn't bother to wipe the floor since there was still foundation liquid by the toilet. When I checked out of the hotel, the hotel automatically charged me $8 CAD for every night I stayed. They never once told me about this charge. On top of that, I didn't even use any of their 'facilities'. I made a point to go check it out right before I left and it was dinky with a few machines and a small pool. I would not recommend staying here. You can get a nicer hotel for the same rate. They try to get guests by offering free internet and parking but you end up getting a small, noisy, dirty room and they still find a way to automatically charge you for the faciliites to make up for the package. I could have stayed at a nicer hotel like the Sheraton or the Hyatt for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: MontrealCampobasso
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of spending two nights at the Metropolitan Hotel on Dundas. I don't care how convenient the location might be, don't make the same mistake too many others have made. Stay away from this joke of a hotel. The room I had was a double. I inquired about a change of room and was advised, "I won't lie to you all doubles are of the same quality". What a sad statement about a hotel like the Metropolitan. Because of this experience, I will never stay at another Metropolitan hotel. If you're idea of an enjoyable evening in a hotel is, stained carpets, mould invested washrooms, inadequate air conditioning systems...need I go on, then the Metropolitan is the place for you. Shame on you Metropolitan for obviously having no respect for your guests, or your reputation. It's a very short sighted way of doing business. Metropolitan, get your act together or get out of this business. It's reality check time Metropolitan, let's hope someone from your organization reads the reviews on Trip Advisor. It's free advice, but priceless. Wake up an smell the coffee, your double rooms are disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels for the same price in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: Super7cyw
Reviews.Content: The service at the desk was the only good thing about the hotel. Scott was more than helpful when we asked to change rooms due to the hair all over the bathroom floor and dirty carpet. Upgrade to a 2 bathroom suite, which was nice upon first glance, however one toilet would not flush proper and the jacuzzi was broken. Hemisphers restaruant was under staffed making a simple lunch of soup and salad take 45 minutes to be served. The $19 breakfast buffet was sad, undercooked eggs and dry sausages.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: mellij
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in, no where near worth the price, staff is un-friendly and rude, lets just say this hotel ruined my birthday weekend away, I am so unimpressed. Toronto has so many nicer hotels with lower prices!

Reviews.Title: “Close to AGO, but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: WestVanMan
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan Hotel in Toronto located on Dundas Street just north of City Hall is one of those twin tower developments with the other tower being a condo. Not that thereâ€™s anything wrong with that, but usually, unless itâ€™s a high end hotel, the hotel portion will usually be somewhat of a secondary affair. We chose the Metropolitan for itâ€™s location close to our daughterâ€™s place near the Art Gallery of Ontario which is about two blocks west on Dundas. There were few others within reasonable walking distance to the AGO. The hotel itself is comfortable. We had a suite with two bathrooms and though we didnâ€™t notice a lock-off door, there were two separate entrance doors. I would guess the place to be about 15 â€“ 20 years old and the bathroom and other appointments were showing their age. The sink faucet handle leaked when the water was running, the bathtub was slow to drain (maintenance?) and the towels were loosing their terry threads. Iâ€™d not seen that before in hotel towels. Wireless internet was free, but it was slow. The rate here was about $220Cdn. We didnâ€™t try any on-site dining, there are two restaurants, one a high end Chinese restaurant and the other, Hemispheres catering to oneâ€™s regular western fare. I checked out the gym and pool, both indoor and completely enclosed with no windows. I never too a dip in the pool though it looked ok, but the gym with about a half dozen machines (treadmills, step machines and sit down bike and some free weights) is claustrophobic. We did not receive a newspaper delivered to the room, though they were available in the Lobby. Never saw anyone manning the Concierge station. We much preferred The Grand on Jarvis where we had stayed previous times, but it was in the wrong location. All in all, the Metropolitan was very average at best and getting dated.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT stay here....worst hotel in YEARS”
Reviews.Author: TwipperVancouver
Reviews.Content: This hotel became a joke. The credit card keys continually did not work (took 4 tries at midnight on check-in to get a set that worked). The room was dirty and the carpet stained. Room was hot and stuffy - when I left the window open it was closed when I returned. The shower didn't work. The "closet" door refused to close without being slammed. My colleagues and I compared notes. One had a non-smoking room but the room next door was smoking so the smoke came thru the ventilation system. Look elsewhere. This hotel is so bad it is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Met? Phooey”
Reviews.Author: ChillyAlbertans
Reviews.Content: Yes Phooey. With no exception this is the worst hotel I have stayed at in central Toronto. I was shocked at the lack of quality in this hotel. There was, to give a few examples, a piece of duct tape holding the carpet in place near the threshhold to the bathroom (abour 14 inches long), the towels were falling apart, one sheet had a hole in it, the carpet had to be 20 years old and was long past it's original colour. The TV was an OLD CRT and the reception was poor. The shower head was ancient (but not old enough to be an antique) and frozen in one awkward direction and the toilet seat was scratched up. The furniture was chipboard crap and old. The closet made no sense (as one review er already noted). The concirege knew nothing and was only there weekdays. The doorman stood in for the concierge and knew less. I am truly shocked that this is part of the Preferred/Met hotel chain. It was in a completely different category form the Soho. Actually we chose this Met after a wonderful experience at the Soho Met.....I don't know what to say....the experience was awful. We checked out early. The funny part (which reminded me to put this review together) is the email from the Preferred Group which starts out "I trust you had a wonderful stay"...lol, well, no, but thank you for presuming I did. Stay away...why they have four stars on this site is beyond my comprehension. The wireless internet was as slow as I have experienced. They try to charge a "facility fee" for local calls (made none) and internet (wireless that was so slow...well never mind). I refused to pay it. You should too.

Reviews.Title: “Do not ever stay here this is by far the worst hotel in toronto”
Reviews.Author: katietirado
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel in toronto. When we arrived at the hotel our room smelled of smoke and cheap perfume. When we complained we were told that that was the smell of the cleaning products used to clean our room. When we were finally moved to another room you could see stains of where there was blood on the white bed linens. When we called we were assured that everything was clean and had a really hard time getting new sheets. After all this we needed a drink only to find out that a cheap 2008 cabernet was 15 dollars a glass.. i doubt it it even cost that much for the entire bottle. When we got back to the hotel at around 2 am. we were greated by a cockroach on our bed. When we called the fron desk we were told that there were no more rooms and that theere was nothing that they could do. Needless to say we didnt sleep well.Breakfast was far moree terrible and expensive. The sausage was not even cooked thorougly (duh swine flu) and the eggs were runny. Completely gross i ended up going across the street to buy a breakfast bar. I would never stay here again if my life depended on it Toronto offers so many beautiful hotels dont stay in this dump!!!

Reviews.Title: “Metropolitan in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: sheronthego
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Metropolitan very much. We were there for 4 nights, and found the price and value excellant. Great water pressure, extremely comfortable bed, clean room, extra large and thick towels. The concierage was helpful and the advance notice "town car" service a bonus. They do have a smoking floor, if you are a nonsmoker and offered a room on floor 15 I would decline it, all other floors are nonsmoking.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Done”
Reviews.Author: French_Viking
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel a few times in the past year, so I knew what to expect. It is not as central a hotel as other options in the city, but it is still reasonably close to the financial core, show venues and other tourist attractions. Just budget a leisurely 20-minute walk to either of them... except for the Eaton Centre (i.e., major shopping centre) which is about a 5-minute walk away. The hotel now provides free wifi service in most of the rooms (it used to be only be offered in the lobby). Some rooms haven't been upgraded yet with wifi capabilities (i.e., they still have ethernet... which costs $10 CAD per day) so make sure to ask for a "wifi room" at check-in. The wifi service is not lightning fast, but it is more than adequate... especially considering it's free. The rooms are very clean and spacious enough. The closets I've had to date in my rooms have been a bit of an oddity, but they do the job. (The are not deep and you hang your clothes "front to back" so they don't hold much.) The bathrooms have always been spotless, though on my last stay, I did notice a little bit of tile grout in the shower/tub area that could use replacing or a good deep-clean... ditto for the shower head... but nothing distressing at all. The beds are incredibly comfortable - pillow-top matresses, duvet cover, soft pillows (and plenty of them) - with soft, white sheets. The room service is fast but the prices are too high. I know that room service is never cheap, but $24 CAD for a simple bowl of pasta and $12 CAD for a slice of cheesecake? At least the service was fast and the food tasted good. I've never tried the Chinese restaurant but colleagues have and they've said it is very, very good. I did stop at the bistro one night for a plate of appetizers and digestifs - it was all good, including the bistro's atmosphere with it's colourful, subdued lighting. Lastly, check out the hotel's website for interesting packages and deals. There are always a few that work out cheaper than booking through online travel companies.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible : no in room dining facility available”
Reviews.Author: skilloakville
Reviews.Content: Bring your own lunch as there is no room service facility available from 11.00 a.m. to 6.30 p.m. Suggest to rename the hotel as " Metroplitan Motel". Rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare at the metropolitan - poor service, terrible rooms and high prices”
Reviews.Author: jocelynlt
Reviews.Content: We felt like we needed a vacation after our stay here to recover from the poor service, lack of basic amenities, run-down and smelly rooms and frustratingly inexperienced and absent house staff at this hotel. NOTE: this hotel has no double occupancy rooms - only singles and "suites" (one queen bed and one pull out couch). The only redeeming qualities were the location (right downtown Toronto) and the daytime bellstaff who were very pleasant and helpful. We requested a late check-in when we made reservations, because our flight would get in late. We arrived to find that not only had our rooms been given away, but the front desk staff (who blamed us for being late) were surly, inexperienced and uncommunicative. There are no staff on at night other than the front desk. We were finally given rooms, which were small, poorly laid out, and reeked of smoke. We had reserved for one double occupancy and one single, but the front desk mixed up our keys, sending myself and my coworker to share the very small room with one queen bed, and our other co-worker to have the office suite to himself. Eventually this was rectified (now 1 hr after we checked in) however it took three calls to the front desk and 40 minutes of waiting to get bedding for the pull-out sofabed I was forced to sleep on. Eventually it was the front desk person who arrived with the sheets and was content to have us make the pull-out couch up for me until we demanded that he assist us. I had to sleep on a pull out sofa because they had no double occupancy rooms (the standard 2 queen bed rooms that every other hotel has). It turns out that though we booked and paid for double occupancy and they had none at all to offer. Their "office suite" was the next best thing, and it was a very poor use of space. Business travellers will find amenities, but they are not helpful, and the internet is very slow. There were some attempts to provide service to business travellers - including a printer & paper, etc. but fax costs were prohibitive, and the printer was old enough that they didn't have USB cables. the internet - whether wired or wireless was terrible. The room we had had a new-ish fan/heat/ac system, which worked well, however the beds lacked basic warmth/weight blankets. both my colleague in the real bed and myself felt that they were stingy with the blankets - when we requested them, the front desk person told us to turn the heat up in the room, with a smile on her face. This hotel does not deserve your business. Period. Don't waste your time staying at a hotel which will only add stress to your travel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid: hidden charges, very slow internet connection, treated rudely”
Reviews.Author: TJFrank
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times on business, and the price of the room was covered by my group, so I really have no comments on that. My complaint is with their internet service. I've stayed in many hotels across Canada and around the world. Some hotels charge for internet access and some don't. That's fine. BUT, when a hotel DOES charge for internet service, it says so on the login page. If I don't see a notice on the login page stating the price, I assume that it's complementary, and my assumption is always correct. The one exception is this place. They charge a very high amount for the internet service, and there is no notice on the login page. When I complained about this on checkout, not only did they still charge the full amount, they were very rude about it. To make matters worse, the internet was INCREDIBLY slow, way slower than in ANY hotel I've ever stayed at, complementary or not. Unfortunately it's not entirely up to me where I stay when I'm in Toronto, since it's booked as a group by my company. So, I'll make the best of it while I'm there, but I'd suggest avoiding it if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: oaklandannette1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Metropolitan for 6 nights on business. I found it to be a great location. It was handy for all parts of the city. The bed was very comfortable, but the rooms were in need of overall cosmetic touch-ups. One point about the front desk staff is that they were all efficient to the point of being almost unfriendly. The bell hops and valet parking guys were all very friendly. Parking is not included and they provide no discounts to guests or any discount for long term stay. Wireless is only available in the lobby and mezzanine. Fine hotel and great location. I will stay here the next time I am in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “affordable, clean & very standard”
Reviews.Author: vancouvergal_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and for just over $100 per night, we couldn't expect more. From the outside, the hotel looks great and the lobby is average. The location is quiet and very central -- you are two blocks from the Eaton Centre. The room was very tiny and the bed was comfortable but simple. You get what you pay for. It's not a room for romance but if you don't plan on spending a lot of time in your room, it will do.

Reviews.Title: “Trick or Treat”
Reviews.Author: danioko
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan Hotel is one of many hotels in Toronto, which is tucked away on a back street hiding its many delights. Located on one side of Nathan Philips Square the hotel is ideally located close to all events which take place on the square from massive charity walks and concerts to various cultural concerts and markets, wonderful!! The hotel itself is nestled nice on Chestnut Street opposite a residential apartment block and the student residence of the University of Toronto. Don't let this put you off however. The street is neither bustling nor overly loud, so sleep will not be disturbed. From the outside the hotel is very 'concrete' and plain with a simply canopy of the front entrance. At first glance it is very pleasing. Once inside the hotel is wonderful and almost boutique looking. There is a medium and spacious lobby with a large flower display in the middle, which always looks fresh, to the far end is the reception area. As soon as you reach the reception area it is like oyu have been entered in to a lottery. You either receive a pleasant, cheery and welcoming receptionist or sadly you are presented with a tirey, grumpy and stern staff member. Again it is sadly luck of the drawer. For the most part however, staff on the front desk seem to be pleasant. I have stayed in the hotel approximately 30 times this year so far. A lot of these times I have stayed on business as I work as cabin crew. Other times I have stayed as a general guest because there have been some reasonable deals. I have found a very clear case of elitism in this hotel. When I am uniformed and checking in I receive a golden service 9/10 times. When I check in as a regular guest it's hot or miss I'm afraid. Again the type of room you are given also seems to be hit and miss. I have been given twin rooms (2 Queen beds), single rooms (1 large Queen bed), deluxe rooms and even a double sweet. All rooms are pleasant, however some do venture more towards to small side and some what dated. There is no continuity between rooms either. My golden tip for this hotel regarding rooms is to do your research before booking. If you are in Toronto during a major event such as the film festival, fashion week or arts festival you should always book early. This way you are not only guaranteed a room but also escape receiving one of their 'last minute' rooms. These rooms tend to be VERY close to air conditioning units and are very very loud and disturbing. The lottery regarding this staff (mentioned earlier) also comes in to effect here. When you call down to the front desk it is again hit and miss whether or not your problem is sorted or whether you receive a sarcastic answer. The bathrooms do need updating considerably but are usually very clean. I have only ever had a handful of cases where I have had to complain regarding the bathroom, all of which have been resolved quickly. All rooms have some form of view, whether it be the CN tower, Nathan Philips Square or other views of the city. Some great photos can be taken from your window. The other nice fact is that your are literally 2 minutes walk from the shopping, which in my opinion is BRILLIANT!! the Eaton centre, which is literally around the corner hosts all the shops you could wish for catering for every need. Back to the hotel and we now explore the facilities. The swimming pool is small yet pleasant. For a hotel this size, with major competitors on its door step you would expect a wider range of facilities or at least more luxury facilties. To one side of the pool is a small jacuzzi bath, which again is pleasant and exactly whats needed after a long day shopping and dining. If swimming is not your thing, the hotel does have a small fitness suite, which is very much to be desired. It sadly offers just a couple of machines to help with various levels of fitness. Again if fitness and swimming is not to your desire and you would prefer to dine then The Metropolitan offers a couple of restaurants, which are actually very good. As I am a flight attendant I eat in restaurants all over the world and in many outstanding top class restaurants. I have to say that although these restaurants are no Michelin star establishments they are actually very good. The Hemisphere restaurant is delightful at all times of the day, at night it is especially nice with its mood lighting. fHere you can enjoy a east for all the senses, Hemispheres blends an eclectic and innovative menu, an exhaustive wine list and glittering atmosphere into a unique experience. Again duing busy times in the city, this restaurant can become very busy so booking is advised. Next is the Lai Wah Chinese restaurant. I have to say this is a fantastic place to eat. I would definately go as far as to say it rivals many of its counterparts in Hong Kong. The restaurant offers some amazing decor also, which you find yourself taking home in your mind ready for a make-over of your living areas. Overall the hotel is a great place to stay and offers accomodation exceptionally close to many of the attractions. The staff and rooms are again part of a lottery but either way I am sure most will not be too disappointed with what they receive.

Reviews.Title: “Very unsatisfied--there are better options in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: ashsem
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel twice and had the same ho hum experience both times. The rooms are small and reasonably priced but EVERYTHING else is expensive and very poor. WiFi is expensive and not included in the room rate. The "Business Center" has two computers and a printer which is not nearly enough for such a large hotel. There is always a wait. The parking garage is usually full so you have to use the VERY expensive valet rates. The food in the restaurants is good, but the service at Hemispheres is AWFUL. This hotel was formerly a Holiday Inn and that is what it looks like inside the rooms. On the plus side you are very close to city hall, the AGO, the Eaton Center, and China Town, and two subway stops. But we have had much better stays at other hotels in the city. The nearby Sheraton is much nicer. For an unforgetable experience, splurge on the Hotel LeGermain on Mercer Street--worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Room not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights while attending a conference. I must have been given a standard room because it was small and the decor was fairly dated. The bathroom was in serious need of cleaning. On the positive side the bed was comfortable and the service was good. Unfortunately for the same money you can get much better value in the downtown core.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a refurb”
Reviews.Author: PJC_7S
Reviews.Content: Downstairs the hotel was fine however my room was like stepping back in time. Clean but very dated. The bathroom was the worst. Paid Â£100 for the night, and I am sure that there must be better hotels available for that kind of money. I would recommend shopping around and if you can't find anything better, then enjoy the trip back in time!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great.....”
Reviews.Author: Manico
Reviews.Content: Booked a one night stay at the hotel that was for their Wi-Suite. Greeted at the door by an attentive and friendly doorman. The lobby was nice but does not exude luxury or upscale. Had a suite on the 14th (actually 13th) floor that was right near the elevators----basically 2 adjoining rooms were they removed the bed from the first room and replaced it with a sofa and desk/chairs. Room looked old and tired and definitely not what I expected but this is an "historic" hotel so if you like that when traveling this room might be for you. Wi console was available in the sitting room and had Wi-Sports and Wi-Fit programs available----battery was running low on the remote so I'm not sure if they check it or wait until someone reports it to have died. Bed was quite comfortable but duvet was extremely warm and we had to have the a/c on all night which was very loud and didn't necessarily cool us that much. Location is good just right off Dundas Street and close to Eaton Centre and Dundas Square (TO's version of Times Square). Didn't eat at the hotel as it looked overpriced but there is a decent Chinese restaurant just across the hotel called Garden that is quite reasonable and good. Overall, I wouldn't stay here again given the high price as there are definitely better looking hotels in town----more for people who like to stay in older/historic hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Questionable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Traveller200247
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights at the Metropolitan Hotel in October 2008. The hotel is very busy and the service is very good. We arrived at 9:30a.m. and our room was already for occupancy. That was great since we didn't have to store our luggage until the room was ready in the afternoon. We had asked for a room with a view of the CN Tower from an upper floor when I had booked and they said they would try to accommodate us. We were put on the eighth floor facing an apartment building where people hung their underwear in the windows each night to dry. The room was small but it was quiet and we weren't distracted by noise from other rooms or from the street. They classify this as a 3 1/2 to 4 star hotel but it isn't. The room we had was in dire need of upgrading. The tile in the bathroom needed replacing and the carpet was filthy and needed to be replaced. I don't think the windows had been washed all year and the curtain rods were pulling away from the ceiling. The bed was comfortable and the linens were soft, white, and cozy. My wife got a strong electrical shock from the make-up mirror in the bathroom when she turned it on with wet hands. We told the desk about that on our departure. The dining room serves wonderful food but is very pricey. We ate in the bistro one night and had breakfast the morning we left. Again, $9.00 for two danish and orange juice is pricey. The atmosphere of the hotel is very nice when you enter. The lobby and the dining areas give you the impression this is a well cared for hotel until you get to the rooms. I don't know if the other rooms were as much in need of renovations as ours but it was disappointing as we had heard good reports about this hotel. As for location, it is excellent. It is within walking distance of everything downtown. It is only a block from St. Patrick subway station and minutes by subway to anywhere in the city. Tim Hortons is down the street and Wimpy's Diner is about half a block away towards University Avenue where you get a good big breakfast for very reasonable price. Would I stay here again? Yes, but I would ask for an upgraded room when i book or I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Views!”
Reviews.Author: quattromonti
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just next to Toronto town hall and 3 minutes walk from Eaton Center. Rooms a big and beds are very confortable. There is a charge for internet in the room but in the lobby it is free! I guess for the price it's one of the best 4 star in Toronto downtown!

Reviews.Title: “good location but needs some refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: motoguzzi-cruiser
Reviews.Content: Hotel has excellent location. easy to walk to Eaton Center and entertainment locations. Rooms are normally sized but a little outdated and would need some new furnitureâ€™s. We stayed a week. Room (1602) was not deeply cleaned on arrival but after leaving some change each day we did get excellent cleaning service. Windows open by a small gap. Noisy air-condition. Hotel mainly frequented by business people. Gym and pool are small. Did not try the restaurants but the bar.
