If you looking for some good cocktails donâ€™t go there. if you have a car, be prepared for a very tricky and tight parking garage. Fee is 20,-day but for some reasons we did not get charged. Overall a good value for money if you pay not more than 130,- CAD per day.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and dated”
Reviews.Author: Chula_Banana
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby is nice and service was very good. Rooms, however, are tired and dated. The teal green carpets were stained in spots and faded all over. The curtains are large floral print swags. The furniture is semi-opaque peach stained oak with pickled white. The showerhead in the bathroom was a once-almond colored plastic that had yellowed with age. The beige tiles in the bathroom and the old television contributed to the ageing feeling in the room. In serious need of an update!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4*”
Reviews.Author: happyCanadian
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for our wedding. Being North America's only 4* Chinese Restaurant/Hotel Venue for weddings, we expected a whole lot more for the money that we spent above and beyond the cost at other venues. Here is our review of the hotel 1. We were extremely dissatisfied with the level of service we (my family and friends) were given with respect to the hotel rooms. All of our guests had difficulties in obtaining their rooms in a timely manner. Moreover, upon receiving their rooms, they were extremely tiny and unsuitable. My brother was offered a smoking room for him, his pregnant wife and two children, which to me, is unacceptable. Upon declining this room, he was offered a really tiny queen size bed (apparently more like a double) for the 4 of them to sleep on. At this point, he was frustrated, as his wife was extremely stressed and physically suffering (her feet and legs were swelling due to the stress of the room situation and heat). Consequently, he accepted this room to allow his wife to relax her feet and legs. In my opinion, this is not acceptable. That night, they checked out at 3am because his wife had contractions. After spending a night in the hospital, it turns out that the contractions were caused by stress - in my opinion it was very likely that the accommodations at the Metropolitan Hotel greatly caused this stress. They were then discharged to go home. Another bridal party member was also offered a smoking room, of which he declined because his fiancÃ©e is allergic to the smell of smoke. The entire point of getting a hotel room was for him to relax (i.e. go swimming, etc) while we were out in the limo taking pictures, without having to go home to his North York house during the day. As the room wasn't ready and he had very expensive professional camera equipment on him, he had no other choice but to drive home, drop off the equipment and come back, which totally defeated the purpose of getting the room. Had he had known this would have happened, he would not have booked the room. By the time he got back, the parking lot was full and he had to pay for parking again. Furthermore, the room was extremely small and smelled disgusting - I didn't believe him when he told me, so I checked it out in the morning.. It was not up to standard in my opinion and I did not agree with how the hotel could have put him in that room. Another friend waited all afternoon for her room in the lobby - she was hoping to be able to catch up on some of her medical research she was working on, however she feared that if she did not wait, she would not get a room. I did not find out about any of this until June 8, 2008. Upon discovering the deficiencies in the hotel accommodations, I decided to address the issues with the Front Desk Supervisor. Of all of the hotels that I have stayed in, I have never been spoken to the way he spoke to myself. He told me, "It's not that your wedding is not important, it's just not a priority. The airlines are a priority." As soon as I heard that, I was saddened. The list goes on.............. I expected a lot more from the Metropolitan.. So much for having your wedding at a hotel to convenience your guests.. 2. I was totally disappointed with the level of service at the wedding reception. The food was not adjusted as previously requested at the tasting. The rice was hard as a rock and noodles mushy. The rest of the food was just ok, but you have to expect that for how much you pay. The votive candles went out and were not re-lit and they threw away the rose petals that we bought for the bathroom. I cannot believe that they threw out my wedding cake. As per the contract, they were supposed to cut the cake for all of the guests and serve it. Instead, they cut one slice for the 'Cake Cutting' ceremony and that was it. The rest went to the garbage. As for the sweet table, it was a complete waste. They were kindly asked on 4 occasions to pack up the remaining sweets from Senses (at least 4 cakes and dozens of mini pastries) and they did not, as asked. They did not follow any instructions. Clearly, the Metropolitan did not uphold its' reputation and did not even try to rectify these discrepancies. Can you believe it??? North America's only 4 * Chinese restaurant / venue of its' kind.. Please stay clear of the Metropolitan to stay or for any important event in your life. They are truly unworthy of the business.

Reviews.Title: “In need of work”
Reviews.Author: AndrewEC1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel last year and because of it's location I decided to stay there again this year. I booked a best available rate for a double room, and this is what I got, but the room had a real noisy air conditioner, it had not been deep cleaned in a while and under the desk nobody bothers to vaccum.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler01Spain
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three days and the experience was great. I booked a room with a king bed, but I was upgraded to a suite, which was perfect. It was in a corner of the building and from the window there was a nice view of the CN tower. The bed and the pillows were extremely confortable. Everything was clean and the rooms were big. The hotel location is a few minutes walk from the main square in Toronto and the main shopping malls. There was free WiFi in the lobby, although not in the room. For sure, I would come back again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good luck getting through on the phone!”
Reviews.Author: LLori
Reviews.Content: While the hotel was perfectly fine, good luck trying to get through to a guest. I've called numerous times today trying to reach a guest who stayed there after I left Toronto to never reach an operator. That is unacceptable. Finally, I called the guest on their cell phone and they called the operator to inquire/complain about my inability to get through, then I was able get through. I guess the operators finally got off their duffs to answer the phones!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: WindsorVillain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights last year and was reasonably happy with the stay. The room was clean and tidy, although a little dated, and the bathroom was very clean. The location was really good, a metro station nearby, and we found plenty of restaurants and bars we liked within short walking distance. It's not the fanciest hotel I've ever stopped in, but was a good place to explore Toronto from.

Reviews.Title: “Metropolitan Conveniently Central Location”
Reviews.Author: TiredCanadian
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan is an independent hotel that is conveniently located -- walking distance to the Four Season's Performing Arts, Nathan Phillips Square, parts of China town, the AGO. Close to the University subway line. My King-size room was smallish, but clean and comfortable. Parking is tight (lots of columns) and valet parking might be a good option for nervous drivers. The fitness centre is okay -- pool is more for relaxing than real swimming. While the hotel restaurants are amazing, they are pricey. There are amazing budget options right around the corner on Dundas Street -- Thai food at Evergreen was especially lovely. Interestingly, I was told the hotel was "sold out" by hotel reservations, but had no problems finding a room on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: greeny_4
Reviews.Content: I was a bit surprised when I read all the negative reviews. I stayed here 5 years ago and thought it was great, but was worried that things have changed. I shouldn't have been. Got a nice, large, smart room with a CN Tower view (asked for). Room was clean, modern and refurbished. Hotel is nice, staff are helpful and location is great. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: CharlieDC
Reviews.Content: Lovely accommodations, fantastic location, and superb service. I feel that I got away with a great price on Orbitz and would definitely stay there again. Travelers should be aware (especially travelers booking their stay here on Orbitz.com) that there are multiple "types" or "levels" of rooms in this hotel. If you want high speed internet you will have to upgrade to a higher level room.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Dan_M71
Reviews.Content: Most people are reluctant to book hotels that are not flagged by the big brands. Which in my opinion sometimes is the safest route (in certain countries) but in many circumstances a big mistake. The Metropolitan may not have 2000 hotels world wide or be a house hold name or have it's heiress with her own TV show like the Hilton's lol :) but I can assure you being an independent hotel it ranks well above most flagged hotels anywhere. The service received while at the hotel is exceptional both in the bar, main restaurant and the fantastic Chinese restaurant. The rooms are a good size, comparable to that in any other 4+ star Toronto hotel, in room internet is fast both wireless and wired, the beds were the only thing I had a problem with..... I didn't want to get out of bed in the morning!!!!! I really loved the Asian decor in the common areas. The property is immaculate and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I was surprised to see such high number of affluent guests more the Four Seasons type clientele - thus proving my point this is truly a hidden Gem. The Metropolitan Toronto is definitely a very well polished hidden gem - don't be afraid of staying at this independent hotel - great location, rooms, and service - the whole package. Well done guys - I'll be back for sure! D

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Andries
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were at the hotel in late November and the best part was the service we received, which was excellent! The hotel decor was OK, and the room was quiet and had a nice view of some of the downtown core. It was a little bit small, but we only stayed for 2 nights and most of the time we were out shopping, so it didn't bother us that much. The most memorable part of our stay was after we checked in when we asked the concierge about tickets to a show (I think Manuel was his name...he was a young fellow) and he give us great, informed recommendations. He seems to know a lot about shows in downtown! After he explained what was going on in the city we decided to go for the musical by Queen "We Will Rock You", and he not only booked the tickets for us, but got us a 50% discount! Before the show we wanted to get something fancy for dinner because we were on a short getaway for our anniversary and were trying to make the most of our time away, and the same concierge made reservations for us at Adega, a restaurant near the hotel that he said was one of his favorites. We got there, and I guess he had told them it was our anniversary, because they gave us a nice gift as we were eating dinner! When we got back to the hotel after the show he was still working, and he addressed us by name and asked us how the dinner was. This is what I consider 5-star service...professional and caring from beginning to end. The trip went very soothly, and we pretty much had everything organized for us while we were there! After our city tour the day we were leaving, the airport car we had ordered was on time and ready for us, which made getting home hassle-free. It was a dream getaway, and I will definitely consider staying at the Metropolitan Hotel the next time I am in Toronto, mainly because of the level of personal service we received. We were treated like stars...thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Toronto has better options”
Reviews.Author: jprmilwaukee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. But that's where it ended for me. The "internet access" advertised on the website when I booked my room meant using a phone line for dial-up. The down duvet covered bed was a blanket with 2 sheets on either side of it. When I asked the concierge to help me get tickets to the hockey game, he told me to walk down to the arena and get scalped tickets... so I promptly went to my room, used my dial-up internet access, and ordered them for face value on Ticketmaster. When I asked for recommendations on where to eat, I was told to walk around because there "is lots of stuff nearby". With all the options Toronto has to offer, I'd pick any one of them over this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Substandard - so many better options”
Reviews.Author: jnugent
Reviews.Content: There are so many other options in Toronto in this price range - why reward a sub-standard hotel with your business? The location of the Metropolitan isn't bad, and during my stay I encountered one or two friendly staff, but beyond that I would say this hotel is really unacceptable, and I would urge anyone considering it to go elsewhere. Don't be fooled by the out-of-date but respectable looking lobby - the rooms are very shabby and run down. Apparently only half of the rooms half internet access, and the check-in staff are either unable to or indifferent about determining which you will be getting. The room had very old dirty carpet complete with stains, no real closet - just something that was tacked onto the wall as an after-thought, and a banged up old window heating unit with no thermostat. The bathtub had yellow-brown stains in the bottom and the grout between the tiles was brown and black in places. It really reminded me of a college dorm room. Also the staff other than the one or two I mentioned were generally cold and not very helpful. They were very put out when I requested a late check-out for example. At the Delta Chelsea down the road if you sign up for their free delta preferred program you are garaunteed a 6pm late check-out (and priority check-in etc.). Just don't stay here. Look at the Delta, the Marriot, or even the Courtyard by Marriot a few blocks further down. They all are in the same price range and offer superior service and room quality to the Metropolitan. Oh yes, and the restaurant was very mediocre and over-priced as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarjieWales
Reviews.Content: I had booked a Superior grade room and then I saw all the negative reviews, and wondered what I had done ! The hotel must have had a major overhaul, because I found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful, the rooms were spotless and were very comfortable and tastefully decorated. The air-con is very noisy, but I soon got used to it. The food was excellent- using the best ingredients. The breakfast buffet was delicious, with plenty of choice, and I had a delicious steak in the Hemispheres Restaurant. The Bistro also served delicious meals, and the staff were very nice. Bottled water and ice were left in the room every day. It cost less to stay here for 5 nights, than at a 2 star hotel in Long Island New York for 3 nights.The Hotel is also very conveniently located, within walking distance to all the sights. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeTigger
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay at the, metropolitan found the service at reception excellent with fast and efficent check in/out concierge very helpful he was able to organise a trip to niagra falls for us. house keeping was excellent and the turndown service was nice this included free bottles of water and ice delivered to your room. We booked a luxury room which was tastfully decorated but a bit on the small side. The hotel is idealy located for a short city break as it is central to most attractions and shopping only a 5 minute walk to the eaton centre and about 20 minutes from the cn tower.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kat22London
Reviews.Content: It seems to me that other reviewers must have been writing about another hotel altogether! Check-in and out was fast; the conciege polite and very helpful. The room was very clean and serviced every day. Yes, there could have been more cupboard space but we have learned to travel light anyway. We didn't eat at the hotel but can thoroughly recommend Maxwell's Rocket 88 Diner (a mere two minute walk away) for their wonderful huge breakfasts. We would certainly stay there again. It was in a great situation for shopping and entertainment and in easy reach of streetcars and Subway links.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Jenran
Reviews.Content: While attending a business conference in Toronto, I stayed at the Metropolitan. The room was OK but on the third night I awoke to a feeling that something was crawling on my skin. I swatted it and killed it and turned on the light. I found smeared blood and what looked like a smashed bed bug. I whipped open the covers and found another one. I know enough about bed bugs that if you can see them, the room is infested. I told the management upon leaving a few hours later, and was only given a mild "I'm sorry sir." I won't stay there again. Bed bugs can easily get transported back to homes via luggage so my wife and I washed everything and vacuumed what could not be. If you have to stay there, inspect your room closely. I came home with many itchy bites.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: macleodish
Reviews.Content: On the last night of my three night stay, I woke to discover a bedbug crawling up down my arm. I smashed it and blood flew everwhere. moments later, I captured a live bug and took both it and the carcass to the front desk. The place is crawling w/ bugs and the management just wants to deny the fact. Further, the rooms are small, walls are paper thin and service inconsistent. I paid Manhattan prices for a glorified dorm room, infested with vermin. Save yourself the grief and find another place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: star675
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan Hotel's website is a complete misrepresentation of what it actually is. I have traveled extensively and this is by far one of the worst. The decor looks nothing like anything on the website and none of the amenities listed were to be found. The room was tiny and with no real closet. The room looked like it belonged in a "country" inn, not at all modern like the photos on their site. Two of the telephones were models not from this decade and were no help when trying to ring the staff. This was a complete disappointment and would NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed stay....”
Reviews.Author: kuiken
Reviews.Content: I spend 3 days in the Metropolitan Hotel in Toronto. The hotel is surrounded by China town and the Eaton Shopping Center. Last mentioned is almost 5 minutes walking. Also the famous CN-tower of Toronto is close by and takes about a 20 minutes walk. My room was ok. Not to big. It had a deal bed with pale blue/grey bedlinnen. Not that sparkling. Unfortunatly there is no fridge in your room, but there is a coffeemaker with teabags and coffeepads. The bathroom is ok. what you need is there. Interesting is the CD-player in the room. You can play your own Cd-s form home, or play the newest ones you just bought in the neighbourhood. The breakfest was ok. The waitress offered a menu or a buffet. I choosed the last one. The cooffee was tasteless. The buffet was not overwhelming but for me it was ok. Had a nice window-table with a view on Chestnutstreet. I also visited the small gym on the 2th floor. It was not easy to find, but I found. What did I see. A small fitness area, with treadmills and other exercise equipment. The view in the gym is a litlle swimmingpool. During my visit the towels were often checked and replaced. Made a good impression. Of course it's small for a big hotel, but it is there and that;s the most important thing. It was there and well kept! Service at the frontdesk was neutral. Polite and helpfull. In short: a Relaxed stay

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Fosh
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel as we considered it's position would be a good base for our break, which it was, we were able to walk everwhere we wanted to go to. When we arrived and went to park our hire car in the Hotels car park, we were shocked to find that guests did not receive a discount on the $19 per night charge ($24 if you ask them to park it for you). The car park itself is the worst one we have ever been in, it has the tightest corners and parking areas you could imagine, just pray you don't meet someone else coming the other way when you are entering or leaving! The receptionsist staff were not very friendly or helpful during any of our encounters with them. Our room was clean but tired - we had booked a deluxe room and were given a key for the mini bar - we looked for the bar high and low and eventually went to ask where it was - we were told there wasn't one. My husband said that our room was supposed to be a deluxe room and she said it was deluxe as it had a Queen bed - we expected a little more than a bigger bed for the extra money we had paid. After our first night we told the receptionist that the air conditioning was so noisy we had had to turn it off to allow us to sleep, she said she would have somebody look at it but no-one came so we had to leave it off. I wouldn't put anyone off staying here but I certainly wouldn't recommend it either.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location !”
Reviews.Author: Fun2Fly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, the negative reports aren't deserved, this is a good standard 3-4 star hotel but it depends on what you are looking for (and the price you can obtain). If it's location, the property is in an ideal location close to the Downtown area on Yonge St, the Theatre District and the CN Tower. The waterfront area would be a long walk, however yellow cabs are ok for short trips. Used public transport from YYZ airport (#192 bus to Kipling) then subway to St Patrick, no real problems even at rush hour, though heavy cases not really recommended on the subway due to no obvious elevators, subway still much quicker than the Airport Shuttle which would have taken 90mins to the hotel !! Helpful staff at the info desks at the airport, buy something in the airport shop to obtain exact change for the transit. The property is somewhat dated, the rooms were slightly tired looking and on the small side, but clean and comfortable, free water in the room, ice supplied by housekeeping at 6pm, and a selection of beverages available along with a coffee maker. Just wish I had time to check out the pool ! The classy looking Chinese restaurant was well recommended by a group who had enjoyed their dinner and were leaving while I was in the lobby. Jack Astor's Bar and Grill nearby was recommended as a dinner option, but I didn't have time to try it on this visit, preferring a slightly cheaper option.. Breakfast appeared pricey too, lots of alternatives in the neighbourhood though. The staff were helpful and although this isn't in the Hilton or Radisson category it was perfectly acceptable and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: emmamackintosh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in August this year. We had started our holiday in Vancouver and worked our way accross to Toronto. We stayed in all 5 star hotels and were told by Flyglobespan that this was a 5 star! When we arrived we new straight away this wasn't a 5 star, the reception staff were very unfriendly, we were told our room was ready, a double smoking room, none of us smoke and had asked for non smoking rooms, after a lot of checking she finally got us a room but we had to wait an hour!! We were not even offered a complimentary drink or guidance where to go while we had to wait. When we got to our room it was awful, dated furniture, dirty net curtains and the bathroom was awful, plus there was no where to put our luggage as the room was so small. Our view was looking directly into flats which looked rough and dirty. We complained and got moved to a seemingly recently decorated room. This was not much better but we had to make do with it for three nights. The carpets were ripped, the air conditioning was that noisy we kept wakening up through the night. We really were glad to check out of that Hotel. The only good thing about it was Brian (one of the bag carrier boys) he helped us a lot with our luggage. I would certainly not recomend this hotel to anyone who is looking for comfort or friendly staff, if you want to stay a basic 1 star standard hotel then maybe this is for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandSusan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for a short city break as there are lots of attractions within walking distance. Our double room was very clean and comfortable and the coffee- maker was well used by us.Free bottled water was also appreciated. The queen -sized bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on! The staff were helpful, especially when we misplaced our camera within the hotel.[Fortunately is was found.] Having the pool and hot tub was a bonus after a long day of sightseeing. The price [less the Â£100 per night] was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: TheMorins
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan hotel is a very average hotel. The rooms differ greatly depending on what you book. From what we saw the "deluxe" rooms are the older out of shape rooms. the "luxury" rooms are the newly renovated rooms. We stayed in a luxury room for 3 nights. It was a small room but nicely appointed. The hotel is in a decent location 2 blocks from Yonge St. We would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: reeceyNorthumberland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty average. The reception area is nice and I found the check- in staff pleasant. The gym/pool area is good with a great hot tub, although its looking a little tired. Changing areas were great however. The bar is nice and the food is good. The elevators are really quick and efficient. The rooms are functional but a little tired. Could do with a refurb.On the bright side, however, the corridors were quiet and the shower was really powerful. Good coffee making machine in the room.Bed was really comfortable. To be honest, I didn't find the location that good as other reviews suggest. I found the good bars and shops a bit of a walk away, but nothing horrendous! This is my second stay in the Metropolitan, having stayed previously in 2005, so I knew it was going to be "functional". Its great if you want somewhere mid priced and you're going to spend your day sight seeing/shopping. If you're after somewhere romantic- try somewhere else. Otherwise, it serves its purpose!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: orphangirl
Reviews.Content: If you want to be treated like a stepchild, then feel free to stay here. I called from Montreal on a Mon because I realized that I left my American passport and Blackberry locked in the safe. They said that they wouldn't be able to retrieve them til Wed when the room would be vacated, and it wasn't until I was a little more adamant about getting these two very important items that they offered to leave a message for the guest occupying the room. Though I called several times a day and left messages for the manager, which were never returned, my items were still not retrieved til Wed. We were also nearly run over by the parking valet zooming out of the lot (wouldn't valet your car there either). Overall they are understaffed (one person at the front desk when the hotel was sold out for the night) and completely lackadaisical about any of our complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Worn Carpets, Unfriendly Front desK staff, Tiny Rooms-Go at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: TriniCharl
Reviews.Content: They say everyone's experience is different and BOY DID I HAVE AND EXPERIENCE. Iâ€™ve been to Toronto so many times and decided to try this hotel even though I read bad reviews. I paid via Expedia for the entire stay, however, when I got to the hotel, the front desk clerk who was not customer friendly at all asked for my cc and swiped it for another nightâ€™s rate for incidentals without telling me what she was doing. I gave it to her thinking she was verifying the payment. I was very angry, and spoke to her about her not so pleasant behavior to customers. Then she checked us into a room was very small, only a foot legroom at the end of the bed and the television. I called her and requested to move, but was discouraged by her. The concierge told me that they were other rooms with better layouts, so instead I went down stairs spoke only with the supervisor who tried to help and move me to another room on a lower floor. When we went into the other room I couldnâ€™t believe it, I was still disappointed. I kept on thinking is there a decent room in this place? The carpet was dirty my husband was upset and we immediately wanted to leave. I called Expedia and was told; this hotel policy offered no refunds due to the timeframe, therefore we were forced to stay in this horrid room. The food was very expensive, even though it was quite good i'll give the restaurant 4 out of 5. The location-convenient 2 blocks from Eaton Center. Hotel looks beautiful from the outside but don't be fooled inside it's not worth the money. Upon check out, I heard the supervisor apologizing to another couple for something that had gone incredibly wrong. We literally ran out of there on the 3rd day and checked in at a great hotel close to the airport. We really enjoyed the rest of our stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: dredlockesq
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay at the Metropolitan. I would describe it as a quality, no frills hotel that gives you the same accessibility to the sights of the city as the larger hotel chains downtown, for a much more affordable price. Its best selling point is location. It is only a short walk from the heart of Yonge Street, which is the heart of downtown Toronto. That makes it close to tons of shopping and dining options. The hotel itself was nice. The rooms were on the smallish side but clean and neat. The hotel staff was average. At times you had to wait to get assistance, especially at night, when the front desk clerk would almost always be in the back office. However they were helpful when I had questions. If you are going to an festival type event (Caribana or others) where you plan to be out and about and very active during your stay, then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: lmti41
Reviews.Content: small rooms with no amenities like refrigerator. the hotel charged for internet services and the internet connection in our room did not work. the hotel staff were for the most part helpful and courteous except when a large group of airline personnel showed up at hotel the front desk immediately began to help them even though there was a line of people, including myself waiting to check in. the hotel and rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Flinstones Bed”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine95
Reviews.Content: Hotel is absolutely beautiful BUT if you like to sleep on a rock I recommend it otherwise not a good nights sleep! Asked to change rooms or make bed more comfy. Didn't happen. Wouldn't go back...Great area though!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Experience Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: PleasureDome
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a hotel where the fire alarm went off for over and hour and when I called the front desk was told that it was a test and that there was nothing they could do. Where the hot water vanished the following morning, where my keys were cancelled and I was told I had to "re-check" in for my second night and where my room was not cleaned for the two nights I was there. I called the front desk and the hotel manager "Shane" to complain about my horrible experience and was told that there was nothing they could do. No offer or remedy was forthcoming. Well I can do something about this. I can tell everyone (and I will) that this hotel is to be avoided at all costs, I can make sure that as travel executive and convention group co-ordinator of a large company none of my fellow employees ever have to be booked in this ghastly venue as long as I am around. The upside to this horrid experience? The hotel is home to one of the finest Asian restaurants I have ever dined in. Lah Wa Heen. The smart money eats there, they just don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Return Anniversary Visit”
Reviews.Author: footdoctor7
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan has become a tradition for special getaways--and again we were overwhelmed with the excellent friendly service and amenities in the room. We tried the romance package this time which included breakfast and dinner, parking, and champagne and chocolates on arrival. Hemispheres Restaurant has been one of our favourites for a number of years and they continue to provide excellent meals with exceptional presentation skills. It is always a delight to study the artistic elements of the dish. Great breakfast selection as well. Exceptional fine linnens and very restfull sleeping accommodation and comfortable suite We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Worn Carpeting, Excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Isky
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel. I stayed on the 23rd floor and had a nice view of the city. The room looks nothing like the website portrays. The furniture was a little old and the carpeting needed replacing years ago. The bathroom was small but a spa robe was available. Bath towels were thin! Nightly, ice and bottled water is brought to the room by housekeeping. The closet is very small and could barely accomodate two days worth of clothes for two people. There is no gift shop in the hotel, but a convenience store across the street was open until midnight. Room service stopped at 11pm, we called 3 minutes before closing and were denied service and went to bed hungry. The breakfast buffet the next day was wonderful. Homemade waffles, fresh fruit and good granola started my day off right. The bell staff were nice and informative. This hotel was okey, but if had a choice, I would NOT stay here again. One exception - very close walking distance to the huge Eaton Cetre (Mall).

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Standard”
Reviews.Author: Vancouvergrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel recently for business. I am familar with the Metropolitan in Vancouver and I thought that this hotel would be similar. I looked on the wesbite and it looked acceptable and the prices were terrific. When I arrived at 11:30 pm, nothing was open, no room service. I've heard this used to be a Holiday Inn and it appears that they made no changes to the furniture at all. Tacky pink bathrooms! The carpet looked dirty. The only thing good about the room was the bed. Some of the food in the mini bar basket had already been opened (gross!). The elevator listed a gift shop but they had none. The entire property needs a face lift. The room service breakfast was great one day, horrible the next. The staff were not professional. I would not stay here again. Certainly, I would be horrified if people associate this hotel with other Metropolitian properties.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, friendly service with world-class food”
Reviews.Author: CafAholic
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Metropolitan when I am visiting Toronto. And I definitely recommend it! -The location is great. It's within walking distance to Eaton Centre, the Toronto nightlife, China town, and if you really like walking, to the Bloor shopping area. -The front desk staff, concierge, housekeeping are always courteous and friendly. The concierge is knowledgeable about the surrounding area and makes excellent restaurant recommendations. -The restaurants in the hotel (Hemisphere and Lai Wah Heen) are world-class. Lai Wah Heen takes Chinese (mostly Cantonese) cuisine to a whole new level. If you are a foodie, you must go and try their innovations (truffles in their dim sum!). -The rooms are extremely clean and equipped with robes, great linens, and toiletries. I brought my own shampoo, but ended up using their shampoo/soap the whole time because it was so nice. -We usually get the room for business people, equipped with a big desk, Sony entertainment system, plenty of sitting room. So, this is a pricey (the only "con") hotel, but it gives you what you paid for and much more.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and The Bad...”
Reviews.Author: DiBA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business during January. Check-in was speedy and the clerk was friendly and efficient. In fact, all the front desk and concierge staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is very convenient - a 2-3 minute walk to the Eaton Centre, lots of restaurants close by, and within walking distance to the Entertainment Disctrict. What is not great about this hotel are the actual rooms. The furniture is in disrepair - the arm of the chair fell off when I sat down! - and the furniture generally has seen better days. Most disappointing to me was the uncleanliness of the bathroom. The bathtub in paticular looked like it hadn't been cleaned in some time. The hotel rooms do not have internet access and the Business Centre closes at 6:00 pm. In addition, the walls are very thin and one night I could hear the person in the next room blowing their nose! This is definately not a four star hotel. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Conchobar
Reviews.Content: Having read the varied reviews here I wondered what we were in for... We arrived and were greeted by very friendly front desk staff and processed quickly. We were in Room 1712 which was a corner room which was not overly large but adequate. The room was clean, quiet and bedding comfortable. Room service staff was timely and professional. Housekeeping was timely and unobtrusive. The location was good with easy access to shopping (Eaton Center) and other downtown sites. Overall, the property is quite nice with a fine location and we did not encounter any of the problems described in prior reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: beccx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel back in September. We arrived from New York so the hotel had quite a lot to live up to after experiencing New York standards. The lobby was impressive and check in was fine. We were told that we had been allocated a newly refurbished room on the 18th floor. The room was nice, large bed, good view of the CN Tower but the bathroom and furniture looked like they needed upgrading, strange when we had been told that the room had just been refurbished. We ate breakfast at the hotel most mornings. The service was slow but the food was reasonable, if a little expensive. We didn't try either of the restaurants as we wanted to explore Toronto but we tried the cocktails in the bar which were very good. The turndown service at night was very nice, bottles of water left and a card with the weather forcast for the next day - a nice touch. We used the business centre to get on the internet and weren't asked to pay, despite the chrages displayed. We also used the swimming pool on a couple of occasions which was very nice, we actually had the whole thing to ourselves one time. The hotel was in a good location for the Eaton Centre and was a few minutes walk from the Entertainment District where we found some good pubs and restaurants. We ate at the top of the CN Tower on our last night and had a lovely meal there wathcing the sun go down. We went on a day trip to Niagra Falls which was fantastic, I would highly recommend it. Overall we had a great time in Toronto but I would probably try a different hotel if we every returned, just to see what else was on offer

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at good hotel”
Reviews.Author: anjmodavi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and centrally located, just what we were expecting. Upon checkin, we were welcomed by a very polite front desk man, who gave us a complimentary upgrade for the night stay. We were in a beautiful room with light furniture and a wonderful view of the city. The internet in the rooms is not free (9 dollars per night) but I appreciated being told that at check in. I did use the free wireless internet in the foyer/lobby and in the restaurant. The bistro was very nice, fairly priced, and the server was a very polite young lady. The hotel is a bit older, but for the 150 for the night, we couldn't have asked for more. I would suggest this hotel for anyone who is looking for a quiet night, business person or couple visiting the city. It is not really made for families (as the bedrooms are a tad tiny). When my husband made the booking, I checked TripAdvisor, and was horrified to see the reviews, but I was pleased that I had no problems. Angry people leaving reviews doesn't mean that I am going to be swayed. We had a great time. Thank you Metropolitan, and staff.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: mkkk
Reviews.Content: We were required to stay at this hotel because my husband's work was having meetings here. The check in clerk was very friendly, talked a little too much but it was ok. Lobby is beautiful and elevators are relatively fast. The first room we checked into (non-smoking) had a strong smoke smell. After a few minutes, it was making our throats sore so we requested a change. Someone came up right away to give us new cards for another room. The second room was tucked in a corner at the end of the hall and it was very quiet. The style is outdated but it was OK. Nothing special about this room but it was slightly larger than the first one. Bed was good and everything else worked in the room. Hotel staff do obey signage display on doors "do not disturb" as we called for more towels and they called us back to inform us that housekeeping can't knock because of the sign. That's good to know. After a couple days of not requiring housekeeping, they left a message on the phone (did it internally and the phone didn't even ring to bother us!) asking if we needed anything. Staff was very courteous. Dining at the hotel is very expensive...didn't even bother to try it. Sure the Chinese restaurant looks nice and tempting but you can find Chinese food that tastes just as good at half the price. Hong Shing (around the corner from hotel on Dundas) is pretty good. There was a problem with our length of stay (not the hotel's error) but they were booked and couldn't let us stay another night. There was absolutely nothing they could do so we moved over to Delta Chelsea. Overall, it was ok. Don't expect 4 stars but it's not too bad either. Husband said the meeting rooms were beautiful but the caterers weren't good. Food was horrible and overpriced. They're cheap and tend to not provide enough for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Better business hotels for the money”
Reviews.Author: SWHighlander
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, our nonsmoking room had a strong smell of smoke. When we complained at the front desk, their attitude was that they had no control over what people did in their room, even it was labelled nonsmoking(!), but they did quickly move us. The room was decent by big city standards: very comfortable king bed, a desk -although it only had one available outlet anywhere near it, and a tiny wardrobe with robes. The window had a small area that actually opened, which was nice. Internet in the room (via ethernet) cost about $10/day, and they had free wifi in a small portion of their downstairs lobby, although the lobby was small and had limited seating. The CD player advertised was part of a cheap bedside clock radio. Room decor was modern, simple, light woods and white fabric a la Scandinavian style furniture. I was in Toronto for 6 days for a conference at the Metro Convention Center. The Metropolitan is a non-chain hotel that is further away than most of the bigger chains, and costs about the same -- at least at conference and government rates. One of the reasons I chose this hotel was that they advertised personal service that the big chains don't, especially free limo service anywhere in the downtown area. When I got there, I found out that was not exactly true. The limo is only available for a 3 hour period in the morning, by reservation a day in advance, and only if no other guest had already reserved the only car at the same time. And it doesn't run on weekends. So I wound up fending for myself on weekends, afternoons returning to the hotel, and one of the mornings when it was already reserved. And it doesn't cover the airport. The two restaurants at the hotel are well acclaimed, so if you're into eating at hotel restaurants, that might be a plus. But otherwise, I can't see why a business traveller wouldn't rather stay at the Sheraton, Marriott, Fairmont Royal York, etc. for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we signed up for!”
Reviews.Author: Markandlindsey
Reviews.Content: It is clear (after reading the latest reviews) that there are two types of rooms at the Metropolitan - the 1980's styles rooms which would be lucky to even get 2 stars in the UK and the recently refurbished more executive rooms which are what you would expect from a '4 star' establishment. Be careful which one you are going to get. First part of the story..... We stayed here on our honeymoon - on arrival we were allocated a queen size bed on the 20th floor. The room was horrible! It had horrible 1980's style curtains, stains on the floor and the worst thing was that as our room was right next to the lift shaft so all you could hear was " ping - lift going up, ping - lift going down!". This was inevitably worse in the morning when the business guests were leaving but we wanted a nice lie in! We also had no mini bar and when we phoned up to ask about getting some water at about 11.30pm in the evening as we had not realised this - the gentleman at reception did nothing to help us. I ended up phoning up again and giving him no option but to bring us something up due to the lack of minibar - he then turned up with the smallest bottle of water he could find and presented it to us proudly at the door!!! We then complained twice (first time told no availability to move us unless we paid Â£50 extra per night for a suite) and on the second time..... Second part of the story ... We were reallocated to a twin double bed room on the 21st floor which had recently been refurbished. The room was lovely - complete with mini bar, free water provided at night, turn down service - all of which were not provided in our previous room. Ok the bed was small but it was ten times better than our first room. We thought the area was fine. There is a street a few blocks away called Elm Street which has a number of nice restaurants aand pubs, and it is only a stones throw away from the 'entertainment district'. It worth noting that both rooms had a good view of the CN Tower. Overall i would not choose to stay here again as there must be better hotels available at a much better price.

Reviews.Title: “Better than recent reviews”
Reviews.Author: HockeyFan6
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in Toronto for a few nights over the home opener of the Maple Leafs, and had previously booked this hotel without referring to TripAdvisor. Based on some of the recent reviews, I was quite concerned and even considered changing hotels, but a convention filled the city and I was "stuck". Thankfully, the hotel was perfectly fine. Though there was a reservation "snafu" in my length of stay, the staff immediately made the change without incident (even though the hotel was overbooked). My room was small, but certainly typical of a fine city hotel, with nary a "floral print". I had to use the business center, and did so without the posted charge being applied. The only real concern could be location, which is a block or two off the beaten path - though the subway is only a block away and the Eaton Centre a few blocks away, the immediate area is not terribly vibrant.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here !!!”
Reviews.Author: TheGrimesReview
Reviews.Content: I have just finished compiling a letter of complaint to my travel agent regarding our recent stay at the Metropolitan Hotel which kind of sums up how my wife and I felt about our stay at this so called 4 star hotel. The room we were given was a disgrace with stains on the carpet and dÃ©cor that would not have looked out of place in 1980 and to be honest looked like the last time it was decorated. The room had a stale smell and my wife was actually concerned about going anywhere near the bed or the bathroom due to an unclean feel from the room. We had travelled for 10 days across Eastern Canada staying in some fantastic places and this was supposed to be the icing on the cake. Well it was certainly the most expensive room we paid for at Â£132 a night for 4 nights not even including breakfast. As we had prepaid our hotel through our travel agent we had no option but to spend 30 minutes at reception begging with the unhelpful and unfriendly staff to move us into another room. This could only be done the following day and meant we had to stay a night in the room of horrors. I have attached photos of the dÃ©cor and some of the stains from the carpet to give you an idea what type of hotel this is. After moving rooms it got a bit better but by then we were actually looking forward to the end of our holiday to get out of this hotel. Donâ€™t stay at this hotel if you can avoid it. It needs a serious investment to upgrade rooms, pool and hot tub area and the staff. This would be lucky to get 2 stars in Scotland never mind 4 stars. There are plenty other hotels in Toronto which I am sure will offer better value and cleaner rooms that this place. We will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, smelly not what we were promised”
Reviews.Author: KarenRenee05
Reviews.Content: Terribly disappointing, would not recommend to anyone. After being promised a "lush, modern hotel" with "many recent renovations" we were given a outdated, tiny room with visible mould and stains on the floor for our anniversary weekend away. Following our complaint they upgraded us to at least a cleaner room, albeit not what we were promised for the rate. Overpriced, over-hyped . . . and to finish our experience the fire alarm went off needlessly for approx. two hours Saturday afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay at this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wschstrtrvlr
Reviews.Content: We had a five day stay at this hotel and it was depressing. By day two I was longing to return home. This hotel is incredibly over-priced for the shabby state that it is in. All the work is in the lobby and the rooms have been totally ignored. The first room that we checked into, had what appeared to be a dirty cleaner in the tub. The staff later told us that it was an error on the part of the contractor and in order to fix it they would need to re-glaze the tub. To which I responded, that that's the cost of doing business, You can't charge almost $250 for a room in that condition! They then moved us to another room, that had a constant bad smell in the bathroom. I went out and bought Lysol to spray everyting down and the smell persisted even though I ran the exhaust fan constantly. Towards the end of our stay, I realized that the smell was coming from the vent. I guess there was either mold, or something dead up there. Sadly we were stuck there because my husband was there on business. We will definitley, not be staying there on our next trip. They also bill it as being downtown Toronto, when it's really at the begining of Chinatown and a few black away from Dundas Square, which is a pretty rough area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel on the edge of Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: welshglobetrotters
Reviews.Content: We booked 5 nights at the Metropolitan as a base in Toronto as part of an extended 3 week trip touring Eastern Canada. The USA style grid system of the roads in Downtown Toronto made finding the Hotel easy as we drove there from Pearson Airport, taking the turn off the shore-line expressway at the CN Tower and proceeding up University Avenue to Dundas Street, then a right turn and another right, brought us to the hotel and it's underground carpark ( $20 a night). The hotel has over 20 storeys in a single building with a main entrance on Chestnut Street. There are two restaurants and a bar . We were travelling with our 11 year old son and our first room alloacted (by mistake at reception) had a only a King Size bed, not the two double beds booked. A quick call into reception had another room instantly allocated and we were settled into a lovely 14th floor room with a bay window and a side view towards the skyskrapers of downtown. We had great fluffy bathrobes, immaculate housekeeping and the welcome delivery of some dinner by room service on our first night. The hotel is about 5 mins walk from Yonge Street where all the shops are located; a minute or so from City Hall and around the corner from the extensive China Town and a myriad of reasonably priced Chinese Restaurants to hand. The CN Tower and the Waterfront are either a 15 minute walk or a $7 taxi ride. They are also on the Gray Line bus tour (see below). There's a Bank of Montreal branch on the corner of Dundas Street, although the hotel will encash travellers cheques to a daily maximum of Canadian $100. Take the Gray Line "hop-on-and-off" double-decker bus tour of the city. The guides are great and give just the right amount of information - often with humour. It stops right opposite the hotel. There are two 'loops' - one which runs North / South and one which runs East / West. Your ticket - available from the Concierge at the hotel is good for 3 whole days - so you can take in all the sights at your own pace and get dropped back off at the Hotel when you're done. A nice little health suite with Jacuzzi, heated indoor pool and sauna complete the experience. A hotel at the centre of the Downtown area - but just off the main thoroughfares to give it a degree of calm. Great for couples and families exploring this vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: redsnap1
Reviews.Content: We arrived and the lobby seemed nice enough. The hotel was billed as a 4 star hotel and yet the room wasn't even clean. There were stains and burns on the carpet, bedspread, and furniture. The paint was peeling and there was black marker grafitti on the night stand and wall. The bathroom was dingy and moldy. The views were nice but that is about it. We went downstairs and very politely asked for another room, that ours seemed rundown and unclean. The woman at the front desk apologized and said the the hotel was having some updates done and that we must have been in an older room, but was not very helpful or sincere. The second room was exactly the same -- dingy, run down, and a little smelly. When we returned to the front desk and said this just isn't up to 4 star (or even 2 star) caliber, the staff tried to say no cancelations and keep our deposit. After some discussion we were able to leave with not charges. We drove around the neighborhood, found an internet cafe and got a nice price for the Westin Hotel right on the water. It was lovely and had even better views. Try not to do what we did and just skip the Metropolitan to begin with.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: JanieP
Reviews.Content: I must admit that I was worried about visiting this hotel having read the reports on this website after I'd already booked it in England but was pleasantly surprised with the room that we were allocated on arrival. This was our final hotel in our "holiday of a lifetime" to Canada and the one where we were to spend the most nights, and so, on gathering the good points made by other visitors, I took pro-active action before arriving and cheekily emailed the hotel asking for a high room with a CN Tower view. I must say that the hotel delivered!! The reply was courteous and quick, the reception staff were polite and and the room (2312 for information - any rooms ending in 12 would have the CN Tower view) had a splendid view! I can see why some people are disappointed as the room was considerably smaller than others on our trip (it had only one queen size bed in it) and the carpets weren't regularly vacuumed BUT the bed was very comfortable, the linen clean and fresh, the bathroom spotless & supplied with the usual toiletries/facilities and was it nice to have use of a free fridge and room safe (not always the case in other hotels). The desk was rather crowded with coffee/ice bucket/food purchase stuff which would limit the room for a business visitor, but for a tourist, it was ample. The only complaint we had was that they didn't really replenish the tea/coffee used and we had to ring down to ask for more BUT again, the hotel responded admirably and sent someone up and we picked exactly the type and amount of extras we required with miminal fuss - no problems. The location of the hotel was reasonably central and personally we didn't have any problem with walking 5 mins to the nearest tube station ($2.75 per journey whatever the length). It was only a 20 minute walk to the CN Tower and the hotel concierge supplied a very comprehensive map which showed the major tourist sites, PATH walkways and Subway stations so we were able to get to everywhere we planned to visit. There was a shop opposite the hotel (open 8.00 am to midnight) and the nearest food court and sandwich shop was literally around the corner on Dundas Street so getting food was no biggie. We didn't dine at the hotel but did look in on the gym and swimming pool which both looked well maintained and comprehensive. On a whole, we really enjoyed our visit to Toronto and the Metropolitan. Maybe we got lucky with our room, especially as we didn't mind it being small ( we only used it to sleep in), and our only advise to other travellers is to be cheeky like us and take your chances. You never know, you may enjoy it too!

Reviews.Title: “Not great, or centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Katya_NY
Reviews.Content: We tried to get a four star hotel in Downtown Toronto via Priceline, and were sent to this hotel. I guess I can't really complain, as we only paid $90 per night, and received a free upgrade to a king sized room. That said, I would not stay here again. The hotel is a good distance from the main sights we wanted to see in Toronto, and the subway system is not all that convenient. We wound up taking cabs a lot, which was an expense we could have done without, had we stayed in a more central hotel. The room was VERY small, and I cannot imagine what a room without the free upgrade would have looked like. The best thing about the room was the lovely bed linens, which were a very good quality. The bathroom was quite worn, as were the carpets and furnishings. Also a plus- the fantastic restaurant LaiWahHeen on the second floor. We had a very nice lunch there- a good way to try out a fancy restaurant for less $$. I would rate this hotel as less than 4 star- more likely 3 star. I would not recommend using Priceline for a city like Toronto- the room was inexpensive, but wound up being expensive in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Deceiving website”
Reviews.Author: Chanchita77
Reviews.Content: We expected something cleaner, larger and containing less floral print and design from the 1980s from this "4 star" hotel. There were stains on the carpet and a strange smell in the room. The bed also visibly sagged. Fortunately we were only staying for 1 night, otherwise we certainly would have moved. If this room had been $80, we would have understood. There are many other options in Toronto fort he same price or only a little more. It would be worth the extra $10-20 to stay somewhere else. Their website certainly sells it as something it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt choose to stay again in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The negative side of this hotel was the 5 dollar daily facility charges + taxes which were a con as they were complusory and should have been quoted in the price of the room. Overall felt the charges per night were too expensive for the quality of hotel room. Positive sides of this hotel were: Very comfortable bed and very clean room which was small and had everything we needed, but, but these items were mostly stored in the wardrobe and had to be removed to make room for hanging up our clothes. breakfasts were good and went on until 11am. Lifts were plentiful and quick.

Reviews.Title: “no broadband???”
Reviews.Author: nycnd
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if you need to work during your stay. I booked a room and when I checked in I was tolld that my room didn't have broadband and that I would have to pay $60 to upgrade to a room that had connectivity. That room had a tiny desk, uncomfortable chair, and a air conditioner that was so loud I couldn't keep it on and talk on my phone at the same time.... The restaurant was good, though.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PTD
Reviews.Content: Originally booked in for 7 nights, and paid $270 for a superior room, which was cramped, smelt, had dirty windows and tatty carpet. Wardrobe space was non-existent. The breakfast consisted of cold srambled egg & bacon and frest fruit that was off. Left after 1st night. The staff were good & refunded breakfast charge. I was told the Manager had left recently & it was known that the Hotel was suffering as a result. Went to the Park Hyatt, told different experience. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a week over Easter at the Metropolitan in Toronto. From arrival to departure we were given prompt and courteous service. The front desk staff were more than happy to answer any questions and we always found them very polite. Our room was very clean with a comfortable bed which was turned down every evening. Our room was quiet and had a view of the C N Tower,so we slept with the curtains open all night to make the most of it. Toronto was a very good choice for an Easter holiday as we were able to go to the Easter Parade on Sunday at The Beaches. The C N Tower was great we went up twice once during the day and one evening to watch the sun go down. We also went to the Basketball at the Air Canada Centre and to Baseball twice at the Rogers Centre. We also booked a trip to Niagra through our hotel which turned out to be a very nice day out thanks to our guide Patrick. I am sure at some time we will return to Toronto and am sure we will stay at the metropolitan again. The food was great and the whole stay was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jclaresparkle
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Metropolitan Hotel for a week in Mar 06. This was my first visit to Canada. We had booked through Trailfinders and it cost around Â£62 per night , per room. I think our room was upgraded on arrival - we were on the 12th floor. The room was very nice - it seemed to be very clean, crisp white sheets and white fluffy towels. It had all the usual facilities you would expect. The hotel was situated very near (5 mins walk) to the Eaton Shopping Centre and was right next to Chinatown (handy for takeaways). It was also handy for the streetcar across town. There is a small conveniance store across the road which is handy for drinks and snacks. there is also a food store in a shopping centre (Atrium on the Bay) that sells everything you would need. Also an off licence in the same complex. We ate in the hotel a few times. Room service on the first night we arrived - the food was lovely and very well presented, only problem was not having an area in the room to eat it! We had breakfast on a couple of mornings in the bistro - a buffet style breakfast which is good value if you are hungry, expensive if you aren't! The bar service in the bistro was terrible (as mentioned in other reviews) I felt as though I was being a nuisance to the staff by asking for a drink or the bill. All in all the hotel was pleasant enough, quiet & in a safe area. I would recommend it although if returning to Toronto would maybe look a hotel nearer the theatre district / Dundas square where there seems to be a bit more life!

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm no worldy traveller but I'm pretty sure this is not the top notch hotel that it claims to be. We were given a very small room that despite a tiny bed still made me feel claustrophobic, the carpets were dirty and the bathroom again was cramped. Nice lobby and good gym / pool are the only positive points.

Reviews.Title: “can't get receipts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan as part of a conference package in February 2006. Room was okay and restaurant very good. I made the mistake of checking out through the automated system on the tv and therefore didn't have a receipt for reimbursement from my employer. Despite repeated phone calls, voice mails and emails, they do not respond to my request for a copy of the expenses/receipt. I am recommending to the conference organizers that they reconsider using this hotel for future conferences or that they advise attendees against automated checkout. I won't stay there again because of this poor service.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the room and washroom was smaller then I expected, other then that, its a nice place to stay. very easy to get a taxi any time of the day. hugee underground parking, although I thought it was a bit expensive. very friendly and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: davies1980
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Toronto for New Years eve, we had a reservation at another hotel but they messed up the rates, so I called a few places, and foung the Metropolitan hotel - which I had seen in the brochures before, they were fantastic, got us 2 rooms from 29th december for 4 nights at a good rate and guaranteed it for the whole stay. the rooms are lovely and the staff are very friendly and the room service is excellent. The hotel bar leaves a lot to be desired - the decor is great, but a shame about the service! Room service food was lovely, and the breakfast menu in the hotel restaurant was fab too! the hotel is only 2 blocks form the Eaton centre, and there are always cabs outside the hotel if you want to go anywhere else! The 4 of us (2 couples) had a great time and would recommend this hotel to anyone. Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously cheap stay and a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: colinrchorley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan hotel way back last April for 7 nights. This was the first time my wife (then girlfriend) had been to North America. First impressions of the hotel were very good, we checked in pretty quickly despite a few people being in front of us in the queue and got a room up on the 5th floor. The room itself was fairly large, had a view towards the Eaton Centre, the shower was very nice, huge but comfortable bed but one negative we found out pretty quickly, it was right next to the elevators and ice machine and it seemed the whole floor required ice on the first night as it was pretty loud and became quite annoying in the end. We made use of the hotels restaurants and ate at the Lai Wah Heen on the first night and I have to say it was the best Chinese food I had ever tasted. We also had breakfast at Hemispheres, this was not so good. The prices I found were a tad on the expensive side for what you were getting and each time we went not once was anyone on hand to sit you at a table. So you end up standing around like a lemon waiting for someone and in the end we just sat ourselves down waiting for one of the staff to see us and take an order. Perhaps a little short staffed. The location was fine, just behind City Hall and there was a convenience store just a short walk away at the top of the road for snacks and drinks. Most of the sites were easily within walking distance of the hotel. We paid a price of only Â£56 per night which is an absolute bargain. Overall a pleasant stay but if we ever go back to Toronto we would look for a hotel a bit closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Average - Careful of phone reservation booking”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: Be aware that when you call to book the SOHO Metropolitan Hotel, this hotel (The Metropolitan) is owned by the same company. We thought we were booking the SOHO Metropolitan and ended up with a reservation here. Very disappointing to say the least. We were able to upgrade but had to pay ad additional $60. It's an average hotel "trying" to be modern like it's sister SOHO Metropolitan. We stayed one night and checked out the next day for the Hotel le Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Great after upgrade”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Toronto Metropolitan Hotel for three nights, from December 10th to December 12th. The purpose was for a business trip, and I was originally booked in a deluxe room for $150 a night. I have read reviews here on TripAdvisor, saying that the sound proofing is poor, and not to get a room next to the elevator. I requested that, and got a room at the end of the hallway on the 10th floor. Once I arrived, the room definitely did not look like the picture on the website. The room looked a bit old and run down. Also, my room faced an outdoor skating rink. It was playing loud Christmas music, which I could hear clearly from the room and was quite annoying. I phoned front desk, and they immediately switched my room for me without complaint. I was impressed by the efficiency of the staff. With the room switch, I got upgraded to a luxury room on the 22nd floor. This room did look like the one on the website. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable, and everything was really clean. The turn down service was nice, and I appreciated the bottle of water that they included as part of the service. The furniture looked about 10 years newer than the room on the 10th floor. I later checked the price on the internet and the luxury room is about $30 more. So if you're thinking of staying at the Metropolitan, I would recommend you paying that extra $30 a night, as there was a huge difference in the rooms. I also had breakfast at the Hemisphere's Bistro at the lobby. I wasn't impressed by the staff there. They barely gave me any service when I told the waiter I just wanted a bagel, instead of the full breakfast buffet. The food was overpriced and not that great. The location of the hotel was not bad. It took me 5 minutes to walk to Eaton Centre for shopping, and travelling to the business buildings and CN tower only took around a 5 minute cab ride. Overall, the Metropolitan Hotel was average. I would say that the deluxe room is overpriced for what is offered, and to book the luxury room if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: teakaym
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Toronto. We stayed at the Metropolitan. First let me say that this was a package that we won from our local radio station...2 nights , 2 buffet breakfast each day. So after reading some of these reviews I was worried. What kind of room would we get for free? Let me tell you we were put on the 21st floor which made for a stunning view of the city. Room was spotless, robes laid out,lights on and music playing. All of the staff was wonderful and treated us like royality. The breakfast buffet was yummie, eggs, sausage, bacon, hash browns, french toast, pancakes, cereal friut and more! And yes the hotel is in a prime location . When we go back to Toronto we will not even think twice about going back to the Metropolitan ! We are there!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average accommodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan on November 25, 2005. The room was very average compared to the one shown on the website. The radiator rattled all night so we had to turn the heat off to sleep. When I called the front desk, I was told that the rooms were not all upgraded to look like the one on the website. She told me that the hotel was full so they could not change our room but later, while in the elevator, we overheard another guest being offered a room change. I was disappointed as it was a special night out for my family member. We could have stayed home in Scarborogh where our rooms are nicer and come to the city for dinner. I called from New York to speak with the night concierge about local entertainmnet and he directed me to the website, toronto.com. I could have stayed at another hotel at a better rate - offered by hotel - and had a better room. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: makis1
Reviews.Content: WARNING! Do not accept any rooms below the 10th floor on the north side of the building. The boiler rooms of the adjacent condo building create such a loud noise when they begin working (5:30 am) that it is enough to rattle the windows! We got no sleep because of that. The room descriptions are very misleading as well. Their "Luxury, renovated" suites are just plain dull, drab and cramped. Their customer service was veru un-helpful and rude when we told them we are cancelling our last night there. In fact they even charged us a cancellation fee of an extra 100 dollars. In total we paid 357 dollars for 8 hours of headaches. Avoid this

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: insomniacsdream
Reviews.Content: i liked this hotel...it was nice. it was small but thats how it goes in toronto. i liked how there was a swivel door and there were many elevators so you didnt have to wait long...also a separate elevator to go to the parking garage. the room was nice. it over looked an apartment building but i could see bits of the city. its located next to china town and thats what you walk thru to get most places. not a bad hotel. it wasnt dirty or anything. there is no smoking in the restaurant on the main floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine experience at The Metropolitan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On a whim, we made last-minute plans to travel from Rochester, NY to Toronto via "The Fast Ferry". Because we booked our seats the night before departure, we were not eligible to take advantage of any of the ferry's getaway packages that included hotel arrangements. So, I researched as many hotels as I could, to try to find a price that would come approximately close to the bargains we would have gotten had we been able to book a whole package. I booked The Metropolitan through Hotels... I am not sure if I got a better rate through them or not; it cost $134.54 + $19.48 for taxes & fees, so all told, I paid $154.02 American. (I might have paid $171.00 Canadian if I'd booked through the Metropolitan's web page ... probably comes to about the same thing). The main thing was that the total of the hotel, plus round-trip ferry fare for 2 people, came to about the same as one of the packages that I'd missed out on. Also, for some reason, I was bent on booking a place that had a pool ...and The Metropolitan has one. Unfortunately, we never found the time or energy to take a dip, so I cannot comment on the pool or sauna in this review. After booking the hotel, I read the reviews here on TripAdvisor and just about had a heart attack!! The reviews here seem to be hit and miss, so I crossed my fingers and hoped that we would have at least an okay experience. We were relieved to find that The Metropolitan turned out to be much better than many of the reviews posted on this site would lead one to believe. So, if you have made reservations at The Metropolitan and are now kicking yourself for that decision, relax!! It's not going to be as bad as you think. The staff at the hotel were all very helpful and friendly. We were greeted with smiles all around -- everyone had a great attitude. When we checked in and took the elevator to our floor, I for one, after reading the reviews on this site, was relieved to find that the carpeting, while not brand-new, was also not completely run-down. I could detect a spot/stain here or there, so it wasn't pristine, but it wasn't "Barton Fink" decrepit and drecky, either. People, "worn and tired" is the St. Moritz in Lake Placid ... this place is perfectly acceptable compared to an old dive like that. Our room was just as tiny as advertised, but we were not in Toronto to hang out in our room, we were in Toronto to get out and see the sites. It sure was a tiny room, though, relative to anything I've stayed at in NYC. The bed was ridiculously wonderful, overstuffed with sheets, very comfy and cozy. The room and the floor we were on and the hotel all smelled JUST FINE. Someone wrote that the hotel was "smelly" so I was concerned about that ... but there was nothing to worry about, thank goodness. Our room had one unfortunate major defect ... right outside our window was a roof ventilator. When we walked in, I heard its low rumble and mentioned it to my boyfriend, but he dismissed it as "city noise" and we were soon out on the streets and off to the ROM. When we came back from our excursions to freshen up for the evening, however, the insistent "RAAHRRMmmmmmm RAHHRRRRRMMMmmm" of the ventilator disturbed even my boyfriend, so we called the front desk to see if they could put us somewhere quieter. They happily complied and found a room for us on the floor above our current one. This exchange happened almost instantaneously for us, we didn't have to wait longer than 30 seconds for them to call us back and tell us what room number they had found for us. They told us that the bed in the other room was Queen Size, not King Size, and asked if that was alright. We said yes and it was off to the 9th floor for us, in a corner unit. It was the same size as our previous room, but had a much better view and the rumble of the roof ventilator was almost undetectable. I personally really missed our King Sized bed, but as we were only flopping for one night, it was perfectly fine. The Queen bed was still quite comfy (though I'm not sure that a white comforter was the best accessory with my post-midnight attack of the Toblerone chocolate bar, greedily snatched from the mini-bar). Bathrooms in both rooms were not in horrible shape, but I was a bit let down by the bathtubs. Both tubs that I saw were very clean -- esp. around the drain where I can usually detect a shoddy cleaning job -- but both tubs had stains that couldn't be removed.
