The bathtub in the first bathroom had a couple of spots (nothing scary or human looking), and the second bathtub had an imprint of an old bathmat on it that obviously couldn't be scrubbed away. While not the worst of crimes, I didn't feel particularly like taking a bath in either tub. The showerheads were fantastic, however, and the water pressure that came out was excellent! We had a good night's sleep, and in the morning, went off to see the concierge to see if he could give us good directions to the Toronto Zoo via public transit. Short answer here -- he couldn't!! He was sweet, friendly and very well-intentioned but he gave us extremely lame advice as to how to get to the Zoo. The route he found for us was one of the more indirect choices ... we only discovered this when we found our own route on the way back, by hopping on a different bus that brought us to a different subway station that had way fewer stops in general than the the line we'd started out on. (BTW -- the Toronto Zoo is well wortha trip, but be warned, if you don't bring or rent a car, it is really "out there" -- I think it should be renamed the "Hour-And-A-Half-Away-From-Toronto-If-You're-Lucky Zoo" -- eesh! ) Overall, we had a great time at The Metropolitan. It is located in the heart of downtown and its central location makes sight-seeing a breeze. The staff is ready to assist you with whatever you need addressed (but take the Concierge's directions to far-flung locations with a grain of salt, grrr!). I would definitely stay there again as long as I can get a good rate and it is a bargain compared to the other, better hotels in the city. I am pretty sure, however, that for $171 Canadian or $154 American, a more lavish experience can be had elsewhere. I for one am looking forward to booking a package at The Sheraton Centre next time we decide to take a ferry ride across Lake Ontario. SUMMARY LISTS: HOTEL AMENITIES FOR STANDARD LUXURY ROOM ---------------------------------------- Bathrobes Iron Ironing Board Laundry Service Bags Coffeemaker Mini-Bar Cotton Balls/Q-tips in Bathroom Shampoo, Conditioner, Body Lotion, Soap PROS ABOUT HOTEL ----------------- Friendly, helpful, responsive staff Award winning restaurants; "Hemispheres" and "Lai Wah Heen" are renowned Comfy Bed Convenient location for major attractions & public transit Pool and sauna on Mezzanine Level CONS ABOUT HOTEL ------------------ Teeny tiny standard rooms Bathtubs need an update, too many stains on tubs Concierge could use a geography lesson WOULD I STAY AGAIN? -------------------- Absolutely, but only *IF* the price is a much better bargain compared to other hotels in the area (Sheraton Centre, InterContinental, Delta Chelsea, The Grand Hotel, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay Hotel - Worn and Tired”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Metropolitan on a recent trip through Canada. We had read in our guidebook that this was a boutique hotel in the heart of Toronto. I was expecting it to be a chi-chi small hotel, so I was pretty disappointed when we drove up and saw a grey concrete high-rise amidst a bunch of businesses advertised with neon signs. The location isn't bad. The neighborhood, although a strange mix of cheap ethnic restaurants, convenience stores and tourist shops, certainly felt safe, and wasn't too far a walk from any of the Toronto sites we wanted to see. It was about a 20 minute brisk walk to the waterfront, and a 10 minute walk to the entertainment district. But it is the only hotel right in the area and is pretty far away from where most of the other hotels are located, so it feels slightly isolated. The room was even more disappointing. The carpet was so worn and dirty that I didn't want to walk around without my shoes. The bedding was okay, but not luxurious like I expected in a so-called boutique hotel. The bath products were nice, though! Service was fine - no complaints though we didn't have too much interaction with staff members since we were out much of the time. There are so many hotel options in Toronto that I don't think I'd stay at the Metropolitan again and would try someplace else instead.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: popstarz2000
Reviews.Content: I checked in late and the staff was just miserable. The rooms I was given was very odd, the door opened on a very long corridor, but the room itself was tiny (nice view) and looked nothing like the picture on their website, which must be for a higher room type. The room was clean but average decor, the bathroom looked tired. Only good thing was I had a good view, and the best thing of that hotel is the location. Their low season rates are good, so if you just need a good place to sleep, it's a good choice but don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Distinctly average!”
Reviews.Author: nib
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel. Stayed here for 3 nights as part of a USA / Canada fly-drive vacation. Tiny room, though it was clean. Good location, a short walk from Yonge St and the Eaton Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and overrated, not 4 star quality”
Reviews.Author: docbonnie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my birthday/Labor Day weekend and were disappointed. First of all, we requested a non-smoking room and found ourselves in a room that reeked of tobacco. We called the front desk to be relocated. They stated they would arrange our room and call us back, but after 15 minutes with no return call, we went down to the lobby ourselves and our room still wasn't ready. After waiting in the lobby (again), we were placed on the 11th floor, with no apology. The carpeting in the hallway was dirty and stained in its entire length. The carpet in the room was also dirty. The room did not smell, but the bathroom was disgusting. It smelled like bad mildew/body odor that you could smell from the door. We were tired after driving, so we decided to just deal with the room because overall, it was "better" than the first room. The bathroom looked clean so we never figured out where the putrid smell was coming from (?shower curtain/tub?). Even after the cleaning ladies came in the morning, the smell remained. The A/C is extremely loud, so we had to turn it off at night just to sleep. The mini bar had some empty bottles that someone had drunk and put back. The saving grace about this place was the location. We also obtained a decent rate through expedia.com. Still, there are many hotels in town and we will not return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel and great location. The wife and I had 2 double beds as the queens were all smoking ... but the room was clean and upgrades had been done. A few other reviews spoke about the rooms being tired and run down ... our room was fine. Business center on the 3rd floor was great and the staff were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpfull. The Business center was also a postive for site seeing and to check your email. The room was a little small but the King size bed made up for it. $228 all in for a night. Not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: simonthecellar
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Metropolitan was lovely and the staff was always helpful. If you are traveling with a car, use the hotel's valet parking. The parking garage is a nightmare so it's worth the extra few dollars daily not to have to navigate the hairpin turns and ultra-narrow spaces. Also be aware that there is a $100 penalty if you need to check out before your reserved date.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, small rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Antonia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel for 3 nights when we landed in Toronto. Travelling with an infant, staff made us feel welcome and set up a cot for us with appropriate bedding. The location is great for shopping and walking around Toronto, there is a childrens playground down the street in Nathan Philips Square which is safe and clean. The swimming pool although small was clean as were the sauna and changing facilities. The only thing that let the hotel down were the room sizes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tyrreld
Reviews.Content: The past year I have stayed on several occasions at the Metropolitan on Chestnut Street in Toronto. In the past, I have stayed at several other well regarded hotels in the city and the Metropolitan remains one of my top three. The pros are a great downtown location. It is very easy to get anywhere, as the subway is 1 block away, and a taxi to most anywhere downtown is under $10.00 CDN. There are great shopping venues (anything from clothing to grocery to liquor), restaurants, and spas, within walking distance. The food at both restaurants in the Metropolitan is excellent and the wine selection is very good. The wait staff are prompt and attentive. There is a very nice bar downstairs, off of the dining area, where one may eat or just relax. The rooms, while small, are of adequate size, well appointed, and are always clean. The linens are very good and the beds/pillows are comfortable. Service, whether it be room service, maid service, or concierge, have always been friendly and of high quality. I find the price to be very reasonable; I see some notes of $300 CDN or more per night - I have always found rooms for $225 CDN or less. I book direct by phone; I'm not sure if that accounts for the difference. The cons are: that I cannot request a specific room in advance, there is no loyalty or rewards program, and the air-conditioners tend to be noisy. Ask for a room away from the elevator as it too is very noisy - calling out each floor in an electronic voice as the doors open.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Allan-Paula
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything you could want for your visit to Toronto. Very friendly staff and a good fitness suite. The swimming pool and hot tub add to the package. If we return to Toronto we know where we will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “King Room was tiny - not even chairs to sit on! Can't shut out light during day”
Reviews.Author: pwrshift
Reviews.Content: I just needed the hotel for one night and got the King Room - don't know what was deluxe about it as it was terribly small. Other than a king bed which filled the room, there was a smallish desk in the corner with a desk chair...so you and your guests only had the bed to sit on! Imagine...$205 a night for not much more than a closet. Way overpriced for what you get. Big disappointment and it's no wonder they don't show the room on the website or nobody would go. When I checked in the AirCond wasn't on and it was about 100 degrees or more...and it took ages to cool off and only then marginally bearable. The air conditioner is a noisy single unit like you find in cheap motels. Forget sleeping during the day - the drapes are short (not to floor) so when the sun rises so do you - last time I saw this was an old Holiday Inn motel. Reservations was a problem - they only gave me a confirmation number and were reluctant to email me confirmation. They did it the next day, after I had left for Toronto, but there was no problem checking in. Room Service was good, and quite reasonably priced. The mini bar was also more reasonable than normal - $3.50 for a coke for example. If I was staying there again I would upgrade to a suite for about $100 more - but that puts the hotel price in a different category where you might consider a better place, like the Marriott Eaton Center, Hyatt, 4 Seasons, etc. I did not find the location as good as other reviewers...kind of a seedy area predominately Chinese. Valet park $24 - self park in bldg $19.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this hotel is amazing, but the reason it got 4 stars and not 5 is due to the room size, For 200-300 pounds per night i expected somthing a little bigger. Now thats out of the way I can talk about the good stuff: Staff- The staff were polite and helpful and there was always someone avalible. Rooms- Although small, my room had a great view of Toronto which included the CN tower. Every room has cable and movies and games can be bought. In each room there is a coffee maker, CD player, three telephones, heater, mini bar, safe and the biggest beds ever. The bathrooms are nice with HUGE mirrors, a bath, shower, sink, toilet and great shampoos, conditioners, soaps, shoe buffers, shower caps and the like. Restauraunts + Bar- There are two restauraunts in the Hotel, a Chinese and a just all round food place which serves great burgers/steaks and lots more. The Chinese place is a little expensive but the food is excellent. In the morning you can either choose from a set breakfast or have a buffet. I had the buffet every day, its more food than i've ever seen in my life: bacon, sausages, ceral, bread, toast, potatoes, scrambled eggs, pastries, fruit, and thats only about half of it. Other stuff: Great swimming pool and jacuzzi which are usually empty during the day (because this hotel is mainly used by buisness men/women who work during the day). The pool opens at 8am and stays open untill 8pm. In the changing rooms there is an unlimited supply of towels, and a number of lockers. Also in the changing rooms there is a sauna and some showers. Right next to the swimming pool there is a smallish gym, with lots of machines and TVs. If you want to go to anywhere in the city or further afield then you can go to reception and they will sort it out for you and make any bookings. This hotel is really worth the money your paying and is in walking distance from hundreds of bars and restauraunts (including a hard rock cafe) and lots of shopping centers.

Reviews.Title: “Fair but not up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unlike the hotel's shiny and grande lobby and its two posh restaurants, the "deluxe" room is fairly basic. In fact, it's the smallest two-bed room I've ever stayed in in North America and surprisingly dated. I last saw faucets, shower heads and toilets of their kind in my parents home when I moved out 20 years ago. The hallway closet is actually a linen closet. The telephone didn't work, and except for an apology and a repair the next day, we received no compensation for the numerous trips to the lobby payphone we had to use instead. I'd recommend this hotel more for its location than anything else.
